Maryland Scholarships


1St Way Pregnancy Support Center, Inc. Frederick L. Schmidt Memorial
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student (Students are considered “full-time” for ACM Foundation scholarships if they are enrolled in the clinical phase of a two-year, associate degree Allied Health program for eight or more credit hours.), must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Allegany County, have at least a 3.0 GPA, be enrolled in the Human Service or Elementary Education curriculum. The essay should address the applicant’s community involvement (volunteerism, committee memberships, etc.) as well as state financial need. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

A. James And Alice B. Clark Foundation Aces Scholarship
Will support students who participate in ACES program and have a demonstrated financial need. Maryland Dream Act students or other ACES participants who do not qualify for federal financial aid are eligible for this scholarship.
Note: Please award $10,000 during spring 2020 and then $25,000 per year during 2020-21, 2021-22, and 2022-23. Grant check expected by Dec. 31, 2019. Also, please award to a broad swath of ACES students, including, but not primarily, Dreamers. more...

A. James Clark Engineering Endowed Scholarship
Will support students:
1. Majoring in Engineering;
2. Demonstrated financial need:
3. Grade point average of 3.0 or higher. more...

A. James Clark Engineering Scholarship
Will support students who are:
1. Majoring in Engineering;
2. Demonstrated financial need:
3. Grade point average of 3.0 or higher.
4. U.S. Citizen;
5. Students planning to transfer to any four year institution;
6. The recipients will be chosen with input from MC’s Engineering department. more...

Supports business students. more...

1. Are from Gabon or who have Gabonese heritage
2. Demonstrate financial need. more...

A.L Fleming Memorial Scholarship
This $500, one-year scholarship is awarded to a junior pursing a major in the Perdue School of Business. The student must have 60 credits completed and be eligible for admission to one of the upper division (professional) programs in the Perdue School. Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.5. This student will have demonstrated outstanding leadership potential and exceptional academics. Students must submit two letters of recommendation. more...

Aaron Zumpano Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for male graduates of a Allegany or Garrett County, Maryland or Mineral County, West Virginia high school who are full-time undergraduate students at Frostburg State University. Selection based on academic achievements and participation in extracurricular activites. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Office of Financial Aid for more information. more...

Aauw - Bethesda Chevy Chase Scholarship
The honoree must be a mature woman with high academic standing and financial need. more...

Aauw - Gaithersburg Scholarship
Requirements:
(1) Resident of Montgomery County.
(2) A Woman working towards a degree in Math, Engineering, Physical Sciences (including Fire Science), Computer Science (including Network Engineering, Systems Security, and Web Careers), Technology (including Biotechnology, Auto Technology, Architectural and Construction Technology, and Building Trades), at either at Montgomery College or upon transfer to a four-year institution.
Preferences:
1. Attends Rockville or Germantown Campus
2. Resident of Gaithersburg, Germantown, Rockville, Olney, Upcounty area. more...

Aauw - Garrett Branch Allied Health Book Grants
One scholarship will be awarded to a deserving female student pursuing an AA degree in any Allied Health field and one scholarship will be awarded to a deserving female student pursuing an AA degree in the Nursing program who have also met the following minimum qualifications: Full- or part-time student, must be a resident of Garret County, Maryland, have at least a 3.0 GPA, must be transferring to an ACM Allied Health AA program from Garrett College, and must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Funds from this scholarship will be used for books during the first year at ACM. more...

Aauw - Kensington/Rockville Scholarship
Must be a female student, supporting a family, and returning to school. more...

Aauw - Silver Spring Scholarship
Recipient must be a re-entry woman working towards degree and/or single parent. more...

Aauw Gaithersburg Scholarship
Supports students who:
1. Demonstrate financial need
2. Is a Resident of Montgomery County and went to a Montgomery County High School
3. Female
4. Is working towards a degree in Math, Engineering or physical sciences (including Fire Science)
5. Attending Germantown or Rockville Campus (preferred)
6. Is a resident of Gaithersburg, Rockville, Germantown, Olney or the Upcounty area. (preferred) more...

Academic Achievement Award For Transfers (Aaat)
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled part- or full-time at the University of Maryland, Baltimore County. Students must be community college transfer students and have completed a minimum of 35 credits. Due date and number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. more...

Academic Excellence Leadership Award
Scholarship for incoming freshmen and transfer students enrolling full-time at Frostburg State University who have outstanding leadership abilities. Selection based on leadership activities, letters of recommendation and academic achievements. Eligible students are selected from the admissions application. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable Contact the Admissions Office for more information. more...

Academic Excellence Scholarship For Entering Freshmen
Scholarship for first-time, incoming freshmen enrolling full-time at Frostburg State University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.2 GPA and minimum SAT score of 1050 or ACT score of 23. Eligible students are selected from the admissions application. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. Contact the Admissions Office for more information. more...

Academic Excellence Scholarship For Transfer Students
Scholarship for transfer students enrolling full-time at Frostburg State University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.8 CGPA and a minimum of 30 transferable credit hours. Eligible students are selected from the admissions application. Due date and number of awads may vary. Renewable. Contact the Admissions Office for more information. more...

Academic Excellence Talent In The Arts Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen and transfer students enrolling full-time at Frostburg State University who have outstanding abilities in Theatre, Dance, Music or Visual Arts. Selection based on academic achievements and auditions, portfolios, and/or interviews depending on area of specialty. Eligible students are selected from the admissions application. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable Contact the Admissions Office for more information. more...

Accounting Association Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time sophomores or juniors at Frostburg State University who are majoring in Accounting. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 CGPA and a 3.25 GPA in Accounting courses. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Accounting for more information. more...

Accounting Department Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students at Frostburg State University who are majoring in Accounting. Selection based on academic achievement and potential. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Accounting for more information. more...

Acm Retirees Association

Applicant must describe long-term educational and career goals and state financial need in essay on scholarship application. more...

Must be a current member of the National Student Nurses’ Association. more...

Afcea-Bethesda Chapter Scholars Program
- Majoring in Computer Science, Computer Simulation and Gaming, Cyber Security, or Engineering;
- High School or College 2.5 GPA or higher (weighted);
- Demonstrated financial need (completed FAFSA form);
- Full-time student;
- Current Montgomery County resident;
- Graduate of a Montgomery County high school;
- U.S. citizen or permanent resident;
- Interested in transferring to a four-year school engineering, computer science, computer gaming/simulation, or cyber security (scholarship recipients will be given priority consideration for an AFCEA Bethesda scholarship at University of Maryland, College Park or Universities at Shady Grove); and
- Able to attend an AFCEA Bethesda event (date/time to be determined) more...

Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Alan And Patti Guerrieri Scholarship
The Alan and Patti Guerrieri Scholarship provides academic merit based scholarships for incoming freshman students entering the University. Scholarships range from $1,000 to $2,000 per year. Applicants must be an incoming freshman, have a minimum SAT of 1250 or ACT of 26, cumulative high school GPA of 3.3 or better and submit written essay reflection. Students admitted as test optional must have a 3.7 high school GPA or better in order to apply. This scholarship is open to any major. Scholarships are awarded as renewable 4 year scholarships (8 semesters), provided the student is full time 12 credits or more each semester and maintains a 3.3 cumulative GPA. more...

Allegany College Of Maryland Alumni Association
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Four-State area, have at least a 3.0 GPA, and state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Selection of recipient will be based upon academic record and service to the school and community. Applicant must be an Alumni member, their parents, children, grandchildren, brothers, and sisters (state relationship to Alumni member—example: self, parent, sibling, etc.). Scholarship may be used at any Allegany College of Maryland campus. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, be U.S. citizens/permanent residents, academic achievement, and participation in school and community activities. Preference given to Alumni members, their parents, children, grandchildren, brothers, and sisters. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Office of Financial Aid for more information. more...

Allegany County Opportunity Merit - Spring 2022
Merit scholarships in the amount of $1,000 or more will be awarded each academic year to students who meet the following requirements: must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, be a current resident of Allegany County, Maryland, must have resided in Allegany County for the past three or more years, and have at least a 3.0 GPA. Special consideration will be given to students who express their intention to transfer to Frostburg State University upon graduation from Allegany College of Maryland. more...

Allegany County Opportunity Tuition Subsidy For Credit Students - Spring 2022
Scholarships will be provided to help support the cost of tuition that is not covered by federal or state aid and scholarship support. After applicants complete the FAFSA and apply for ACM Foundation scholarships, and Maryland State Scholarships have been determined, it is expected that up to 1/2 the Allegany County credit-hour rate will be provided through this scholarship fund if students apply and meet the following additional requirements: must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, be a current resident of Allegany County, Maryland, must have resided in Allegany County for the past three or more years, and have at least a 2.0 GPA. more...

Alumni Association International Scholarship (Aa-I)
The University System of Maryland, through the Alumni Association – International (AA-I), Incorporated, established the AA-I Scholarship to recognize exemplary students from Maryland matriculating through a University System of Maryland institution. The AA-I scholarship will be bestowed upon a Salisbury University student who demonstrates academic achievement, strong commitment to community service, and leadership ability. The AA-I Scholarship Committee will review all applications and select the final recipients. A scholarship award notification will be sent to the recipients who have been selected to receive this scholarship. Incoming freshman applicants must have a minimum cumulative high school GPA of 3.50. Transfer students must have at least a cumulative GPA of 3.50 from the most recent institution. Current undergraduate Salisbury University students must have a cumulative GPA of 3.25 or above. Students must be Maryland residents and all applicants must enroll as full-time undergraduate students. All applicants must upload an official transcript and provide two academic letters of reference. This is a one-time only scholarship and is non-renewable, although you may reapply multiple years.
The deadline to have ALL application material submitted, including both letters of recommendations, is April 1st. Incomplete applications will not be accepted.
Salisbury University is a Division III member of the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) and therefore athletic leadership, ability, participation or performance cannot be utilized as a criterion in the determination of your financial aid award. As you apply for scholarships within Salisbury University’s Academic Works scholarship site please do not mention athletic leadership, ability, participation or performance within the essay as it will remove you from consideration for the scholarship to ensure Salisbury University’s continued compliance with Bylaw 15.4.1 of the NCAA regulations. more...

Alumni Association Scholarship Endowment Fund
Established through the generosity of the Loyola University Maryland Alumni Association, this fund serves to foster the opportunity for a Loyola education for legacy students who show strong potential in the classroom with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. more...

Not designed for students continuing their studies at Montgomery College.
For past participants in a Montgomery Ambassadors program for one year.
Students must be transferring from Montgomery College to an accredited four-year higher-education institution located within the United States. more...

American Association Of University Women Frostburg-Cumberland Branch Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students (freshmen ineligible) at Frostburg State University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Preference given to non-traditional students (over 25 years of age) or residents from Allegany or Garrett counties. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Office of Financial Aid for more information. more...

American Citizens For Italian Matters Scholarship Fund
Created in 1996 by members of American Citizens for Italian Matters, Inc. of Maryland, this fund provides support to a full-time undergraduate female student of Italian descent from the state of Maryland. In 2020, the ACIM added additional funding, donated by a beloved supporter of the ACIM mission, Elaine Mintzes, in honor of three ACIM members and women of Italian descent: Irene Piccinini, Marie DeRito and Mary Mangione. more...

American Legion Patriotism Award-Farrady Post No. 24
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students at Frostburg State University who are dependents or descedants of members of Farrady Post 24 American Legion. Applicants must have a minimum 2.7 GPA and major in Accounting, Biology, Business Administration, Chemistry, Computer Science, Economics, Education, Environmental Analysis and Planning, Foreign Languages, General Science, Geography, History, International Studies, Law and Society, Mathematics, Physics, Political Science or Wildlife/Fisheries. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Office of Financial Aid for more information. more...

American Legion Post #13 Robert W. Hartsock
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Bean’s Cove, Flintstone, or Little Orleans area and have at least a 2.0 GPA. The applicant should be an American citizen not opposed to our form of government. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

American Legion Post #13 Robert W. Hartsock Memorial
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Tri-State area, and have at least a 2.0 GPA. The applicant should state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Preference given to a direct descendant of a past or present Post 13 member or a descendant of a Veteran (must state on application). Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

The Andes Family scholarship is available to full time students in the Seidel School of Education at Salisbury University in the Departments of Early and Elementary Education and Secondary and Physical Education. Must be full-time and in good standing in the Seidel School, a declared education major with Senior status and in the capstone or internship phase of their program,must be a MD resident, 3.5 cumulative GPA or higher, and demonstrate financial need from the FAFSA. Preference given to a traditional student who is seeking their first bachelor’s degree, that has matriculated to Salisbury University directly from a high school setting in the capstone or internship phase of studies. This is a non-renewable scholarship. more...

2. Taken at least one anthropology course at Montgomery College
4. Write a maximum 300-word essay that includes the student’s career and transfer plan, current engagement with the discipline of anthropology, and the research the student would like to undertake as part of an independent study course. This essay would be in addition to the essay on the Foundation’s scholarship application;
4. Register for an independent study or honors course taught by a full-time anthropology (or sociology) professor. more...

1). No award will be made for less than $1,000. 2). 3.0 GPA or better; 3). Taken at least one anthropology course at Montgomery College; 4). Written a maximum 300-word essay that includes the student’s career and transfer plan, current engagement with the discipline of anthropology, and the research the student would like to undertake as part of an independent study course. Antoinette Paterakis Lambros And John Paterakis, Sr. Endowed Scholarship Fund
It is the preference of the Donor that two scholarships of approximately the same amount are awarded annually from the Fund by the Office of Financial Aid once the Gift is fully funded. One scholarship is awarded to eligible undergraduate students who demonstrate financial need and have an interest in and proficiency for the fine arts. The other scholarship is awarded to eligible undergraduate students who demonstrate financial need and have an interest in and proficiency for business entrepreneurship. more...

Arbor-X Future Arborist
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Harford County (first priority), Baltimore County, Cecil County, or Carroll County (second priority), or any resident of Maryland (third priority), have at least a 3.0 GPA, and be enrolled in the Forestry curriculum. The applicant must have a “C” or better in Dendrology I. The recipient is encouraged to visit the Arbor-X Company for one day during the Spring semester to experience the forestry profession. A paid (salary & housing) short-term summer internship may be available to the recipient for the summer following the award. The scholarship may be extended into the third semester pending approval from Arbor-X. Applicant should contact Arbor-X for extension. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Arbormetrics Solutions Allegany Alumni Forestry

Applicant must state career goals and how your personality and character can be applied to achieve those goals. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Aris And Marianne Mardirossian Endowed Scholarship
1) The scholarship will support the children of fallen law enforcement officers, firefighters or other safety and rescue professionals or volunteers who are students attending Montgomery College in credit or non-credit courses. Preferences will be given to students in the engineering program;
2) The scholarship can also be awarded to children of fallen soldiers who are students attending Montgomery College in credit or non-credit courses. Preference will be given to candidates who are involved with or supported by the Special Operations Warrior Foundation or;
3) If a suitable candidate for the scholarship cannot be found within the first two criteria, then the scholarship can support recent war veterans and active duty military who are students attending Montgomery College in credit or non-credit courses with a preference to those veterans and active military involved with special operations.
4) On a case by case basis, the scholarship may also be used in part to award a scholarship for the recipient of The Aris and Marianne Mardirossian Endowed Scholarship to transfer to a four-year institution upon completion of his or her Associate’s Degree at Montgomery College. more...

Audrey C. Christopher Endowment For Education - Current Undergrad Junior Level Students In Professional Program
The Audrey C. Christopher Scholars Program provides scholarship opportunities to undergraduate junior grade level students majoring in education. Eligible undergraduate students must be admitted in the professional program in the Seidel School, have a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or better, demonstrate financial need from the FAFSA and be enrolled full-time. The scholarship can be renewed for one additional year if awarded as a junior with a cumulative GPA of 3.30 or better. more...

Audrey C. Christopher Endowment For Education - Doctoral Students
The Audrey C. Christopher Endowment for Education, established in 1996, is intended to provide scholarships for students in the School of Education at Salisbury University. To be eligible for consideration Doctoral (EdD) candidates must be admitted to the program for the upcoming academic year; can be full-time or part-time; must complete a FAFSA and have financial need as determined by FAFSA; and must have a cumulative 3.5 GPA in previous program work. Changes in employment status, tuition remission and/or total income could affect the amount of future award amounts. Part-time enrolled students maybe funded at a lesser amount. more...

Audrey C. Christopher Endowment For Education - Incoming Freshman
The Audrey C. Christopher Endowment for Education, established in 1996, is intended to provide scholarships to incoming freshman majoring in education. The minimum qualifications for consideration include a high school cumulative GPA of 3.3, a combined minimum SAT score of 1200 or ACT of 25, financial need as demonstrated through filing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) for the corresponding academic year and submission of a short writing sample. The scholarship may be renewed for a maximum of 8 semesters provided the recipient remains enrolled full-time as an education major with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.3 and has continued financial need each year from FAFSA. more...

Bernard Dabrowski Memorial Endowed Scholarship
The Bernard Dabrowski Memorial Endowed Scholarship is dedicated to the memory of Bernard Dabrowski, who served as a board member of the former Parent’s Association, was married to a Towson University Alumna, and three of his children graduated from Towson University.
Preference will be given to students whose family members have an active membership with the Towson Family Network.

Blue Freshmen Merit Award - Coppin State University
The Blue Freshmen Merit Award is awarded to first-time, full-time freshmen at Coppin State University. To qualify for this award, you must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.5 and a minimum combined SAT score of 900, and your CSU placement exam must indicate that no more than one refresher course is required. This award is renewable for up to eight semesters. more...

Blue Transfer Merit Award - Coppin State University
The Blue Transfer Merit Award is awarded to transfer students at Coppin State University. To qualify for this award, you must transfer from a community college with a minimum 2.5 GPA and you must have successfully completed at least 25 credits. This award is renewable for up to six semesters. more...

Boa Leadership Scholarship
The BOA Leadership Scholarship is available to incoming freshman students at Hood College. This scholarship is awarded to high-achieving students who have taken active leadership roles in their high school, community, and/or region. more...

Board Of Trustees' Legacy Scholarship
The Board of Trustees' Legacy Scholarship is open to entering freshmen at Prince George's Community College. You must be a recent graduate from a Prince George's County high school, be a resident of Prince George's County, and have a minimum 3.0 GPA with at least a 1150 SAT score. Applicants who have a minimum 3.25 GPA with at least a 1050 SAT/ 23 ACT score or score a minimum 203 on PGCC's reading comprehension test and a minimum 45 on PGCC's mathematics test are also eligible for this award. more...

Bobbi Biron Theater Scholarship
The Bobbi Biron Scholarship is awarded to an incoming freshman who has achieved a 3.0 high school cumulative GPA and shown outstanding dedication and promise in theatre. An audition is required for performers and a portfolio review is required for designers/technicians. Recipients may qualify for scholarship renewal if achievements are met, including a 3.0 cumulative GPA and participation in theater productions. Additional information, requirements and tips to help you prepare for the performance audition or portfolio review can be found at this site: Bobbi Biron Scholarship
Requirements: What You Need To Do
• SU Admissions Application. Submit online application by
December 1 for Freshman Early Action or January 15 for Freshman Regular Decision.
• Please provide a link to download your resume, along with your audition video or online portfolio. Please see for details: CLICK HERE
• Biron Scholarship Application. Submit scholarship application via AcademicWorks. Once offered admission to SU you will be given
log in access to this site in your official admissions letter.
• Demonstrate technical facility, interpretive and communicative skills, intelligence and choice-making, artistic potential and presence, and a sense of humor when appropriate.
• Faculty may contact you for an additional interview.
How to Prepare
• Performance Audition: Introduce yourself and what you will do; perform one 60 to 90 second classical monologue and one 60 to 90
second contemporary monologue; end in a clear, strong, definitive manner.
Work with your drama teacher to select material that suits your age, type, and facility with language and ideas. Pay attention to
enunciation and pronunciation, vocal and expressive choices, character type, and storytelling to create a believable character. Be
prepared to discuss the theme or central idea, the emotional intent or mood of the selection, and what the character is attempting to
communicate. What artistic choices did you make and why?
• Portfolio Review: Seek help from your design or technical director to select and focus on one work. Consider scenery (perspective renderings,
storyboards, drafting, research materials, elevations, model photos, concept statement, and paperwork), costume (swatched costume
renderings, sketches, research material, photos, concept statement, and paperwork), or lighting (studies, storyboards, research, lights
plot, production photos, concept statement, and paperwork).
For additional information about the Theatre Program at Salisbury University click here more...

Camille And Clifford Kendall Scholars Endowed Scholarship
To provide annual scholarships to students in their freshman and/or sophomore years attending Montgomery College. Each scholarship shall be in an amount equal to in-county tuition and fees. A minimum of eight scholarships shall be awarded after Fiscal year 2012. A committee comprised of the College Director of Student Financial Aid, the Scholarships & State Grants Program Director, and any other College staff they deem appropriate, will select the Kendall Scholars each year. Students selected for Kendall Scholarships must:
(1) Demonstrate financial need;
(2) Show high potential for success;
(3) Be U.S. Citizen;
(4) Have a high probability of continuing to reside in Maryland after graduation from college;
(5) Have demonstrated prior service to others (including family and/or community), and
(6) Satisfy other standards that the selection committee deems to be important. Each scholarship recipient shall be assigned a mentor to help to assure each student’s academic and career success. Mentors will be requested by the Office of Financial Aid and may include faculty, staff, and academic and non-academic administrators. The Foundation Finance Director of the Montgomery College Foundation shall approve all expenditures and administer the Fund. more...

Cathell Garigliano Memorial Scholarship
The Cathell Garigliano Memorial Scholarship will provide funding for up to 6 semesters to a current SU student according to the following minimum criteria: full-time undergraduate with a minimum of 30 credits; declared major in History, Political Science or Biology; minimum cumulative GPA of 2.50; Resident of the Eastern Shore of MD from Caroline, Cecil, Dorchester, Kent, Queen Anne’s, Somerset, Talbot, Wicomico or Worcester Counties in MD, Virginia Counties of Accomack or Northampton and Delaware Counties in Sussex, Kent or New Castle; Preference given to a student with financial need; and completion of a short essay (250 words or less). This scholarship was created in honor of Kimberly Ann (Garigliano) Cathell, Salisbury University Class of 1996. Scholarship is available for a total of 6 semesters maximum. Must maintain a cumulative 2.5 GPA. more...

Catherine & Porter Ent Memorial Scholarship
The Catherine & Porter Ent Memorial Scholarship will provide one or more scholarships for incoming or current undergraduate student(s). Recipients must demonstrate financial need and will be prioritized by high academic potential or achievement. Preference will be given to residents of Wicomico, Worcester, Dorchester, and Somerset Counties. If there are no eligible students from those counties, then preference will be given to residents of other areas of the Delmarva Peninsula, including Sussex County, DE, and Northampton and Accomack Counties, VA. The scholarship can be renewed for up to 8 semesters (4 years total) is a cumulative 3.0 GPA is maintained and financial need from FAFSA each year. more...

Catherine F. Vuozzo Scholarship
The Catherine F. Vuozzo Scholarship is available to full-time undergraduate liberal arts majors at the University of Maryland, College Park. Your selection for this award will be based on academic merit, financial need and an essay (2 pages double spaced) on the topic, "What does it mean to be an 'educated' person? What is the role of the discipline in which you are majoring in forming educated people?" You must also submit one letter of recommendation from a faculty member. more...

Charles R. And Martha N. Fulton School Of Liberal Arts Scholarship For Incoming Freshman
The Charles R. and Martha N. Fulton School of Liberal Arts scholarship awards a number of $2,000 and $3,000 scholarships based on outstanding scholastic achievement. To be considered for an award a student must declare a major in one of the departments of the Fulton School of Liberal Arts. Applicants must be an incoming freshman, enrolled full-time, have a minimum SAT of 1250 or ACT of 26, cumulative high school GPA of 3.3 and submit written essay. Test optional admitted students must have at least a 3.7 HS GPA or better in order to apply. Scholarship are renewable each year for up to eight semesters, provided the student remains a major in a liberal arts department, is full time each semester and maintains a 3.3 cumulative GPA. more...

Although any Sussex County graduate is considered, first priority is given to a graduate of Indian River High School and second priority is given to a graduate of Sussex Central High School. Class rank, SAT scores and financial need from FAFSA are considered. Provided recipients maintain a cumulative 3.0 GPA, the scholarship will continue throughout the four years at Salisbury University. The selection committee from the Admissions/Financial Aid offices determines the applicant pool. more...

Clinton Bradway, Jr. Scholarship
The Clinton Bradway Jr scholarship is awarded to an education major. Recipients of this renewable scholarship must meet agree to teach in Dorchester County upon graduation – one year for each year of funding*, and be admitted into the professional teacher education program at Salisbury University. *Note: Failure to fulfill the county teaching obligation will result in recipient’s obligation to return the scholarship funding plus 10% APR interest within 5 years. Recipient must be a resident of Dorchester County, MD. more...

Cma - Certified Management Accountant
Are you planning to be a management, finance, or accounting professional working in industry? Would you like to highlight your current knowledge and skills to interested employers? You could do so by passing the CMA exam and becoming a CMA Candidate prior to graduation.
Through the Institute of Management Accountants (IMA®), graduate and undergraduate students in the Franklin P. Perdue School of Business at Salisbury University can apply for a nomination to receive one of ten CMA scholarships. To learn more about the CMA Click Here
Why take the CMA exam while still in school?
· Students like you have demonstrated a high ability to succeed on the exam because much of the exam content is covered in coursework.
· You’re already in study mode and exam material is top of mind
· You can take both exam parts and submit your work experience later
· The amazing ROI of holding both CMA & CPA certifications Click Here to Learn More
· CMAs between the ages of 20-29 can earn 16% more Click Here to Read More in total compensation than non certified peers globally. (IMA’s 2018 Global Salary Survey)
What is included?
· Entrance fee to the CMA program
· Exam support package with retired exam questions and a glossary of terms
· Registration fees covering both parts of the exam (additional fees will apply for retakes)
· Wiley CMA excel Online Test Bank access for both exam parts for up to two years (U.S. students only)
· Up to three years of IMA membership while pursuing the certification
Am I Eligible?
· Currently enrolled full time in a bachelor’s or master’s business degree program at SU
· Scholarships are awarded based on faculty nomination.
· Completion of ACCT 302 Cost Accounting I with a B or higher at Salisbury University
· Intent to take the CMA exam and become a CMA
How Do I Apply?
· The email address the students should use to submit their application is dals@salisbury.edu
· Please include a statement of purpose in the body of your email, your resume (pdf) attached along with your program of study, expected graduation date, and mailing address.
Who Will Be Chosen?
· Applicants will be ranked based on academic performance in accounting courses and overall GPA.
· Awards will be made to students in order of ranking until (1) all scholarships have been issued or (2) all applicants have received scholarships.
· 5 Awards will be made for each application cycle. Submission for the five spring awards must be received no later than March 1st at 5:00 pm. Submission for the five fall awards must be received no later than October 1st at 5:00 pm more...

Collegebound Scholarships - Baltimore City Public High School Students
Students must have a CollegeBound account to apply so they can reach out to scholar@collegeboundfoundation.org if they are having any technical issues.
College Student Last Dollar Grant Application – *NEW***
• Need-based renewable grant award for current college students with a remaining cost of attendance gap balance due. Applications accepted on a rolling-basis
• Eligibility requirements: Must be a HS graduate from a Baltimore City Public HS; Must be Pell-Grant Eligible; Must be a current student at a 4-year college or institution
• URL Link for College Student LDG Application (must have CollegeBound student account to apply): College Student Last Dollar
Finishers’ Fund Application
• Need-based renewable scholarship established to assist upperclassmen college students who have lost financial aid (Institutional/State/Federal) and/or have faced family financial hardship. Applications accepted on a rolling-basis
• Eligibility requirements: Must be a HS graduate from a Baltimore City Public HS; Must have 90 earned credits or more if attending a 4-year institution; or 30 credits or more if they are attending a 2-year college; Must have exhausted all other financial resources; Must be in good academic standing
• URL Link for Finishers’ Fund Application (must have CollegeBound student account to apply): Finishers’ Fund Application
Upperclassmen Hilton Scholarship
• Major-specific renewable scholarship to support current college students needing additional financial support. Applications accepted on a rolling-basis
• Eligibility requirements: Must be a HS graduate from a Baltimore City Public HS in 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020 or 2021; Must not be a current or previous Hilton Scholarship recipient; Must be attending a 4-year college or institution; Must be Pell-Grant Eligible; Must have a Cumulative GPA of 2.0 or higher; Must have a declared major in hotel, hospitality and/or restaurant management, business, business management, economics or accounting.
• URL Link for Upperclassmen Hilton Scholarship (must have CollegeBound student account to apply): Upperclassmen Hilton Scholarship

Collins - William V. Collins Memorial
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student (no less than 13 credit hours), must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Allegany County, have at least a 2.5 GPA, and state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Colonel Meta M. Mills Nursing Scholarship
The late Colonel Meta Mildred Mills, a veteran of the United States Air Force (USAF) Nurse Corps, was named Head Nurse for the United States Astronaut Program in 1963. Working her way through the military ranks, Colonel Mills exemplified the nursing profession. As a graduate of Cambridge, MD, hospital’s nursing program, she continued her service in the field of nursing by entering the USAF in 1950. Twenty-five years later, Colonel Meta Mills retired. The Colonel Meta M. Mills Nursing Scholarship is awarded to students who are enrolled full-time in the Doctorate of Nursing program at Salisbury University. The recipient must demonstrate financial need from FAFSA and have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher. The scholarship is awarded through the Department of Nursing and is non-renewable. more...

Committee For Montgomery-Anthony M. Natelli Endowed Scholars
(1) Applicants shall be residents of Montgomery County and graduates of a County high school.
(2) Must maintain an exemplary record of academic achievement throughout his/her high school career.
(3) Demonstrate a long-term and continuing commitment to community service.
(4) Indicate a clear interest in pursuing a course of study in the construction trades, civil or mechanical engineering, accounting or business.
(5) Demonstrate financial need and maintain a minimum grade point average of 3.0 for the duration of the scholarship award.
(6) Intend to continue their education at an accredited institution of higher learning.
(7) Provide to the Committee for Montgomery a brief written summary of his/her activities at the conclusion of each academic year. more...

Crabtree Diversity Of Thought Sales Scholarship
Diversity of Thought in the business world allows an organization to explore different ways of approaching a goal through intentionally seeking out different points of view and not following the status quo. The Crabtree Diversity of Thought Sales Scholarship will be awarded to students who have demonstrated leadership through forward thinking, proactivity, and serving as a change-agent in community, campus or workplace situations.
This renewable scholarship will be awarded to a full-time undergraduate student participating in the Mid-Atlantic Sales & Marketing Institute who completes their required One-Day Internship at Pohanka Automotive Group of Salisbury (pool of approximately 6-10 students). Candidate must have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0 or more. You must have participated in the one-day internship this current fall semester. This scholarship will be applied to the upcoming spring semester financial aid for the selected student(s).
After completing the One-Day Internship, the applicant must submit a short essay (250 words or less) explaining how diversity of thought, thinking ‘outside of the box’ or ‘going against the grain’, benefits the workplace by introducing progressive thinking. Applicant must give specific examples of community and/or campus involvement where they have practiced diversity of thought and its effect on the outcome.
The scholarship will award two $2,500 scholarships in the fall semester and two $2,500 scholarships in the spring. The Perdue School Student Development Committee or their designee(s) will select the scholarship recipient(s). more...

Craig N. Piepenbring Memorial Fund
One scholarship is awarded annually from the Craig N. Piepenbring Memorial Fund to a student in good standing in the Perdue School of Business. Particular consideration is given to students actively involved in student activities on the Salisbury University campus. Applications are accepted for the award annually, pending availability of funds. Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 required. However, if the current recipient is a sophomore, he/she may reapply as a junior and will be considered for a second year with all other applicants on a competitive basis. Students must submit two letters of recommendation. more...

Criminal Justice
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full- or part-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Tri-State area, have at least a 2.0 GPA, and be enrolled in the Criminal Justice curriculum. The applicant must have no prior criminal record or drug abuse and should state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Criminal Justice Scholarship
Scholarship for Maryland, Pennsylvania, or West Virginia residents who are undergraduate students enrolled part- or full-time at Allegany College of Maryland majoring in Criminal Justice. Students must have a minimum 2.0 GPA, be U.S. citizens/permanent residents, have no prior criminal or drug abuse record. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

Crisfield Lioness/Lions Club Virginia Puffinburger Scholarship Fund
This is a tuition grant of up to $1,000 for the academic year, paid directly to the institution upon verification of enrollment as a full-time student for their second semester or beyond. For the complete details and application please CLICK HERE
Eligibility Criteria:
1. One thousand dollars is available for scholarship(s) to be awarded yearly in the spring, to either a person that is:
a. At least 18 years of age, graduate of Crisfield Academy and High School or Holly Grove Christian School who reside in the Crisfield (21817), Smith Island (21866 or 21824), Marion (21838) or Westover (21871) areas
or
b. Completion of GED, former student @ either of the above listed schools and a resident of Somerset County for at least 1 year.
2. The recipient(s) must meet all application requirements and may reapply by meeting the same requirements.
3. The applicant(s) must be officially accepted and enrolled for the second semester or beyond into a program or course of study at an accredited educational institution in the U.S. as a full-time student.
4. The applicant(s) must show evidence of having maintained a 3.25 scholastic average.
5. The applicant(s) must exhibit evidence of citizenship by active participation in service clubs, church, or civic activities. Documentation of same must be presented in reference letters from said clubs, church or civic activity representative or coordinator.
Application Requirements:
1. The applicant(s) must be either:
a. At least 18 years of age, graduate of Crisfield Academy and High School or Holly Grove Christian School who reside in the Crisfield (21817), Smith Island (), Marion (21838) or Westover (21871) areas
or
b. Completion of GED, former student @ either of the above listed schools and a resident of Somerset County for at least 1 year.
2. The applicant(s) must submit all of the following documents/criteria to either of the addresses below and have met the eligibility procedures before being considered for an interview and final selection of scholarship funding made by the Lioness/Lions Scholarship committee:
a. Receipt of completed application form. All materials must be submitted by May 1st.
b. Provide a cover letter that summarizes professional goals and objectives, as well as personal achievements which may include church, civic groups, or community service. Include military service if applicable.
c. Receipt of two letters of personal recommendations (non-relative).
d. Receipt of two letters of scholastic recommendation from college educators.
e. Submit a resume of past or present job experience if applicable.
f. Receipt of official transcript for any schooling in the past five years plus your high school transcript or GED certificate. All transcripts must be mailed directly from the institution or certification verified by the issuing source.
3. Applications and all required documents must be mailed and postmarked to the Scholarship Committee (see address below) by May 1st of each year.
ALL CORRESPONDENCE SHOULD BE DIRECTED TO:
Crisfield Lioness/Lions Scholarship Committee
P.O. Box 385
Crisfield, MD 21817
or mswift@somerset.k12.md.us more...

Daly Computers, Inc. Scholarship
The Daly Computers, Inc. Scholarship is awarded to sophomore, junior or senior students at Salisbury University who have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher. The scholarship is intended for students who have encountered a recent and unexpected financial hardship that could jeopardize their ability to continue with their education. The scholarship is non-renewable and recipients are chosen through an application process overseen by the Director of Financial Aid. This scholarship is only available to full-time, degree seeking undergraduate (first degree) students that are taking classes on the main campus at Salisbury University, not at various satellite locations. Available on an on-going basis during academic school year if funding is available. Application submission does not guarantee funding. more...

David Yuri Hooper Scholarship
The David Yuri Hooper Scholarship was established by David and Wilma Hooper to honor the excellent education received by their son who graduated from Salisbury University in 1994. It provides $1,000 scholarships for incoming, full-time freshman students from single-income families demonstrating financial need. The scholarship is renewable annually provided the recipient continues to meet the eligibility criteria. Preference will be given to students majoring in biology, but in the event that there are no qualified biology applicants, students majoring in any other department in the Henson School will be considered. Eligible candidates must submit a two-page essay explaining their need and demonstrating that they are of good moral character. Recipients are selected by the Deans of the Henson School and Enrollment Management. more...

Desantis Family Scholarship

Diane D. Allen Scholarship
Diane D. Allen served as provost and senior vice president of academic affairs at Salisbury University from 2009 to 2017. Dr. Allen was a native of Memphis, TN, and earned her master’s and doctoral degrees in Curriculum and Instruction from Oklahoma State University and her bachelor’s degree in English from the University of Memphis.
The Diane D. Allen Scholarship is designated to defray the costs of dissertation work of students in the Contemporary Curriculum Theory and Instruction in Literacy doctoral program (EDCIEDD) in the Seidel School of Education at Salisbury University. One scholarship will be awarded annually.
Applications for the Diane D. Allen Scholarship should include a brief proposal narrative and budget. The proposal narrative should outline the major components of the applicant’s dissertation research and should be no more than 3 pages in length (12-point font, single spaced, including references). It should clearly and concisely describe the aims and methodology of the proposed research as well as the expected contribution of the work to existing literacy research. In addition to the proposal narrative, the application should also contain a budget (up to 1 page) outlining the direct expenses to be incurred and supported by the scholarship. The budget may be presented via table format.
The awarded applicant will be expected to complete and send a thank you letter acknowledging the support that has been provided for this scholarship. Instructions for writing and sending the letter will be provided.
The proposal will be evaluated on the following criteria:
• Appropriateness of the introduction, including a clear and concise review of existing research and description of the aims/research questions
• Appropriateness of the methodology, including a clear and concise description of the participants to be examined, materials to be used, and design/procedures to be employed
• Appropriateness of the planned analyses in supporting the aims of the proposed research
udget
• Quality of writing and accordance with APA style
Students should not apply for this scholarship until you have successfully completed your comprehensive exam. more...

Preference is given to women’s lacrosse student-athletes enrolled in the School of Education. more...

Director's Fellowship - Glenda Chatham & Robert G. Clarke Honors College
The Director’s Fellowships were established to recognize exceptional incoming freshman students who demonstrate outstanding academic achievement and the promise for leadership and success on the Salisbury University campus. Fellowships range from $1,000 to $2,000 and are awarded as a four year scholarship. For consideration, applicants need to apply to the Honors College using the online application by the priority deadline. Students are selected based on their academic accomplishments (1200 SAT/25 ACT minimum), as well as an additional essay. Recipients are decided by the Honors Admissions committee, comprised of the Director and Assistant Director of the Glenda Chatham & Robert G. Clarke Honors College and the Director of Admissions. Director’s Fellows receive priority placement in one of the Honors Program’s freshman Living Learning Communities. Students are required to enroll full-time each semester, maintain a cumulative 3.25 GPA or better and remain active in the Honors Program, demonstrating successful progress toward graduating with full university honors. They are recognized each year at the Honors Spring Banquet and their names appear on a large plaque that is publicly displayed in the Honors Center. For more information about the Honors College at SU please Click Here – SU Honors College .
Students who are admitted without a standardized test score, as test optional, but have at least a 3.7 H.S. GPA will also be able to apply. more...

Dolle Scholarship
The Dolle scholarships, in the amount of $1,000 each, are one-year scholarships awarded annually to majors in the Perdue School of Business. One scholarship is awarded to a current rising junior Salisbury University student the other to an incoming rising junior transfer student, if eligible. Both students must have 60 credits and be eligible for admission to one of the upper division (professional) programs in the Perdue School. Students who are recipients of any other Perdue School tuition assistance scholarships are not eligible for the Dolle scholarships. Students must submit two letters of recommendation. This is a non-renewable scholarship. more...

Donald Day And Karen Gruner Endowed Scholarship
1) Half the annual distributions of the Fund provides scholarship support for MC students and half the annual distributions of the Fund provides scholarship support for Montgomery College students who transfer to a 4-year program in order to complete their bachelor’s degree.
2)The MC scholarship supports students majoring in physics, engineering, or mathematics who have completed at least 15 credits at Montgomery College and have a cumulative GPA of 3.2 or higher. Scholarship recipients may have no more than one repeated course, must have completed satisfactorily or be currently enrolled in the first calculus course for engineers, and must attempt the first course in techniques of reading and writing prior to or during their first year of scholarship support.
3)The transfer scholarship supports students who were physics, engineering, or mathematics majors at MC and who are transferring to a 4-year accredited institution where they will be pursuing a baccalaureate degree in physics, engineeering, or mathematics.
4)For both the MC scholarships and the transfer scholarships, no preference will be given to any citizenship or visa status. Special consideration will be given to women and minorities. The scholarship awards will be based on the demonstrated financial need of each student, but they will cover at least 25% of the cost of the tuition, fees, and books at the institution where the student is enrolled. All scholarship awards are renewable through the baccalaureate degree based on satisfactory grades and progress in major. more...

Donald Day And Karen Gruner Scholarship
Supports students majoring in Physics, Engineering, or Mathematics who have completed at least 15 credits at Montgomery College and have a cumulative GPA of 3.2 or higher. Scholarship recipients may have no more than one repeated course, must have completed satisfactorily or be currently enrolled in the first calculus course for engineers, and must attempt the first course in techniques of reading and writing prior to or during their first year of scholarship support. more...

Donald Day Endowed Scholarship
1.) Half the annual distributions of the Fund provides scholarship support for MC students and half the annual distributions of the Fund provides scholarship support for Montgomery College students who transfer to a 4-year program in order to complete their bachelor’s degree. 2)The MC scholarship supports students majoring in physics, engineering, or mathematics who have completed at least 15 credits at Montgomery College and have a cumulative GPA of 3.2 or higher. Scholarship recipients may have no more than one repeated course, must have completed satisfactorily or be currently enrolled in the first calculus course for engineers, and must attempt the first course in techniques of reading and writing prior to or during their first year of scholarship support. 3)The transfer scholarship supports students who were physics, engineering, or mathematics majors at MC and who are transferring to a 4-year accredited institution where they will be pursuing a baccalaureate degree in physics, engineering, or mathematics. 4)For both the MC scholarships and the transfer scholarships, no preference will be given to any citizenship or visa status. Special consideration will be given to women and minorities. The scholarship awards will be based on the demonstrated financial need of each student, but they will cover at least 25% of the cost of the tuition, fees, and books at the institution where the student is enrolled. All scholarship awards are renewable through the baccalaureate degree based on satisfactory grades and progress in major. more...

Donald Donahue Tri-State Scholarships
Scholarship for residents of Maryland, Pennsylvania or West Virginia who are incoming freshmen enrolling full-time at Frostburg State University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and minimum SAT score of 1100. Preference given to residents of Pennsylvania or West Virginia. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Admissions Office for more information. more...

Students must have a minimum 3.2 GPA and be U.S. citizens/permanent residents. Number of awards may vary. An essay and a personal statement must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

Donald P. Hutchinson Scholarship
Scholarship for graduates of an Allegany, Garrett, or Washington County, Maryland high school who are full-time seniors at Frostburg State University and are majoring in Education with the intent to teach. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and teach for two years in Allegany, Garrett or Washington counties, Maryland. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Educational Professions for more information. more...

Douglas-Wilson
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-or part-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Tri-State area, have at least a 3.0 GPA, and be enrolled in the Engineering (1st priority) or Mathematics (2nd priority) curriculum. Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Applicant should address the reason for choosing anticipated profession and how the applicant would like to use this profession to improve life for themselves and others. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Dr. And Mrs. Robert Scherr Endowment Fund
This endowment was created to provide a scholarship to current students who demonstrate financial need from FAFSA with an overall GPA of 3.0 or better. Candidates must meet at least one of the following criteria: enrolled in the special education track/minor; enrolled in courses in preparation for certification in special education; or a current student meeting special education certification requirement (taking and passing Praxis II in special education). Special consideration will be given with a focus in communication and/or learning disabilities. Can be renewed for one additional year if awarded as a junior and criteria is still met. more...

The scholarship will be awarded during the semester the recipient is student teaching. more...

Dr. Jessie Fleming Family Music Scholarship
The Fleming Family Music scholarship was established to recognize the great contributions she has made to the students of Salisbury University over many years and to remind the numerous Salisbury graduates of their association with Dr. Jessie Fleming with pride and appreciation. This scholarship will be awarded to one music major or minor who has best represented and promoted the music department. A short essay is required as part of the application process. The decision as to the recipient of the award will be decided by a committee of three with representatives from: Financial Aid, the SU Foundation, and the Music Department Chair. This scholarship will be awarded annually for the fall semester only. The scholarship will not be renewed automatically but students can reapply each year. more...

Dr. Jessie Fleming Music Scholarship
The Dr. Jessie Fleming music scholarship was established to recognize the great contributions she has made to the students of Salisbury University over many years and to remind the numerous Salisbury graduates of their association with Dr. Jessie Fleming with pride and appreciation. This scholarship will be awarded to one music major or minor who has best represented and promoted the music department. A short essay is required as part of the application process. The decision as to the recipient of the award will be decided by a committee of three with representatives from: Financial Aid, the SU Foundation, and the Music Department Chair. This scholarship will be awarded annually for the fall semester only. The scholarship will not be renewed automatically but students may reapply each year. more...

Dr. Kent B. Barnes Geography Paper Competition
This award is open to full-time undergraduate or full- part-time graduate students majoring in Geography with a 3.0 cumulative GPA or higher.
The award requires a research paper or thesis presenting the results of an innovative research project on one or more of the following topics: local participation in natural resource and environmental management, hazard mitigation, urban revitalization, environmental justice and/or sustainable development. more...

Dr. Leroy L. Kohler-Sociology Scholarship

Dr. Lori Dewitt Memorial Scholarship
The Dr. Lori DeWitt Memorial Scholarship is awarded to a full-time student who is majoring in Communication within the Fulton School of Liberal Arts, and wishes to participate in a Salisbury University Study Abroad program or a domestic semester exchange program, and has financial need from FAFSA.
Dr. Lori J. DeWitt was a long-time member of the faculty of the Department of Communication. The daughter of two career educators, Dr. DeWitt’s career path inevitably took her into education. She began her career as a high school teacher in Southern California where she taught English, speech and debate, and coached the high school speech and debate team. She also taught special education and loved working with students with special needs. Dr. DeWitt briefly worked in the television media industry hosting a local cable home improvement show. Ultimately, she decided on a career in higher education and moved with her family in 2007 to Salisbury University where she joined the Department of Communication. She served on various department, school, and university committees and, by the time of her death, had just transitioned out as the chair of the department.
Dr. DeWitt had a passion for travel. She spent important years of her life on the West Coast, in the Midwest, and on the East Coast. She traveled with her family extensively throughout the U.S. While serving on the faculty at Salisbury University, she led multiple study abroad trips to both Guatemala and Scotland. Additionally, she and her husband presented at international professional conferences in The People’s Republic of China and explored setting up study abroad programs in England and Northern Ireland. Dr. DeWitt was very involved in her church and traveled on numerous mission trips to Peru and Macedonia.
The memorial scholarship in Dr. DeWitt’s name supports Salisbury University Communication majors with high financial need to embark on an academic exchange or travel program either abroad or in the USA as part of their college career. Dr. Dewitt knew the educational benefit of travel and wanted as many students as possible to participate in these programs. Scholarship recipients are determined by a combination of GPA (3.0 min cumulative GPA), application essay, and demonstrated financial need. Winners will receive a scholarship up to $1,000 which is applied to any study abroad or study away program approved by the Janet Dudley-Eshbach Center for International Education at Salisbury University. Applications are due by May 15 for the following fall, winter, spring or summer. more...

Dr. M. Shakil Rahman & Dr. Huma Shakil Scholarship

Dr. Samuel F. Trevino Engineering Scholarship
This is a $25,000 current-use scholarship. The Montgomery College Foundation will award up to a total amount of $8,000 per academic year. (The $8,000 will benefit a maximum of 2 students at $4,000 each.) At the donor’s discretion, additional funds will be provided every 2-3 years to maintain a $25,000 scholarship balance. Those selected must meet the following criteria: 2nd year Engineering student; 3.0+ GPA; demonstrated financial need. A scholarship committee will be created and tasked with the annual scholarship recipient selection process. The committee will include Mrs. Juliette Trevino, Dr. Donald Day, Ms. Patricia Lopez, Dr. Sanjay Rai and/or other designee(s) from the Montgomery College Engineering Department. If a committee member is either unable or unwilling to serve at any given time, the Montgomery College Engineering Department Chair will select an appropriate alternate committee member. Please note that unrestricted scholarships are given to students with financial need. If for any reason the Foundation cannot fulfill your request relative to the preferences indicated, we will then use the unrestricted criteria. more...

Dudley-Eshbach Study Abroad Scholarship
The Dudley-Eshbach Study Abroad Scholarship provides $1,000 in funding to a student who is studying abroad in a Spanish-speaking country in Latin America. The program must be a minimum of four weeks in duration and can take place in any term. Requirements for consideration include: good academic standing and making progress towards a declared major or minor in Spanish or Latin American Studies, demonstrated financial need, enrolled full-time and a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0. Selection is made by the Department of Modern Languages. Two letters of recommendation are required. Pay attention to grammar, vocabulary, punctuation and spelling! If you are unsure of the quality of your application, please visit the Writing Center for help. This application period is for a study abroad program for winter or spring ONLY more...

Durling Family Aces Pathway Champions Scholarship
Supports students who meet the criteria below and will be renewable for up to three years until completion of his/her associates degree:
1. First year participant in ACES program
2. Student must qualify for full financial aid (i.e. receives full Pell award)
3. Demonstrates Financial Need
4. Plans to transfer immediately to BA/BS degree program offered at the Universities at Shady Grove to be completed in the next two years and remain in good academic standing
5. GPA of 2.5 or greater
6. Recipient will continue to receive this scholarship at MC and USG, as long as he/she meets the criteria
7. In addition to scholarships, the student may receive support to meet textbooks costs at both institutions and to pay for up to two developmental courses at Montgomery College. more...

Eastern Shore Tuition Assistance Program (Estap)
Scholarship for domiciliary residents (minimum 1 year) of Northampton and Accomack counties, Virginia who are enrolled as commuting juniors or seniors at Salisbury State University or University of Maryland-Eastern Shore. Applicant must be a U.S. citizen or eligible non-citizen. Recipients must be enrolled at least half-time in a degree seeking program (excluding religious training & theological education), and may not hold a baccalaureate or higher degree. Financial need is not a consideration. Due date, award amount, and number of awards may vary. Recipients may reapply annually. Contact one of the participating schools for more information and/or application. more...

Edward & Eysselle Croswell Scholarship
The Edward and Eysselle Croswell Scholarship will provide scholarship support for a student in good standing at Salisbury University in the Perdue School of Business, per the following criteria: a high school graduate of Somerset County, MD, preferably a resident of the Fairmount or Rumbly areas. If there are no qualified students from Somerset County, MD then a student from Worcester County, MD may be selected; a business major; junior or senior grade level and a 3.0 cumulative GPA or better. The scholarship may be renewed for a second year if awarded as a junior and the eligibility criteria continue to be maintained with a cumulative 3.0 GPA, eligible Perdue major and completion of 24 credits each year. more...

Edwin J. Lasner Memorial Endowed Scholarship
The Edwin J. Lasner Memorial Endowed Scholarship is open to students at Anne Arundel Community College. To be considered for this award, you must be enrolled in at least six credits, be a paralegal major, be a U.S. citizen and be a resident of Anne Arundel County (MD). Additionally, you must demonstrate financial need. Preference is given to students who have completed twelve credits of paralegal studies core courses. more...

Elfreth And Assadi Family Scholarship Honoring Women In Public Service
This scholarship is for a 2022/2023 award.
This scholarship is open to Political Science majors who meet the following criteria:
Full-time undergraduate status;
Declared major in Political Science and at least 15 hours of completed coursework towards major or sophomore status;
3.5 cumulative GPA;
Exhibit through example, service, or academic writing or research advocacy of women in public service;
Expected to submit a written reflection on his or her internship experience consistence with the requirements for academic credit.
Additional consideration given to those students who are enrolled in the Honors College and/or are actively involved in student organizations on campus. more...

The Elizabeth Cannon Memorial Scholarship is awarded to students who have excelled academically in high school. Priority is given to a high school graduate (incoming freshman) with a genuine need for financial assistance from Caroline County, MD or the other eight Eastern Shore counties in Maryland. For consideration, students must apply for admission to the University by February 1st. The scholarship may be renewed for a maximum of four years, provided the student maintains a 3.3 cumulative grade point average each semester. more...

Eunice Q. Sorin Scholarship - Worcester County, Md Workforce Development Scholarship
The scholarship program first began in 2011 thanks to the pioneering efforts of Eunice Sorin, a stellar businesswoman, philanthropist, and amazing woman who passed away in 2012, leaving a lasting impact on our local community. Eunice played an active role in the Ocean City and Berlin community, running a highly successful business that allowed her to become a generous sponsor and donor to many great causes. She spent her life in the service industry here in Ocean City, MD and made a bequest to the chamber with the stipulation that scholarships be given in her name. Eunice also fostered a sincere and lifelong interest in the well-being of our youth, education, and the importance of accessible opportunities for advancement in our local community. To that end, the Foundation strives to uphold the ideals established by Eunice by continuing to raise funds each year so that we can continue to award scholarships to deserving people in our community in her name.
Each application is reviewed by a board of prominent business leaders that share in the Foundation’s mission. The applications are reviewed in a blind process against specific criteria. Since its inception, over $28,000 in scholarship money has been awarded to deserving community members – young men and woman that we are confident will continue along their successful path to becoming inspiring business leaders in our community.
The Scholarship Program awards individuals who are either further pursuing professional development to advance their career and/or upgrading skills with intention to stay in the Eastern Shore area. This scholarship is open to those who wish to have, or continue a career in the following industry sectors: Agriculture, Aquaculture, Attractions/Recreation/Arts, Business, Hospitality, Medical/Emergency Services, Non-profit, and the Trades. Applicants must live or work in Worcester County. This scholarship is available to anyone currently employed by a local business in good standing with the Greater Ocean City Chamber of Commerce OR for those individuals looking to gain the skills and education to enter our community workforce.
Applicants must meet the following criteria to apply:
• Must have a completed GED or High School Diploma
• Citizenship requirements: US
• Both full time, part-time, and incoming students are welcome to apply
• Both full time, part-time, and non-working individuals welcome to apply
To be considered as a candidate for the Eunice Q. Sorin Scholarship, please complete the entire application process by the indicated deadline. Be sure to complete all fields of the online application, upload your resume, upload your essay, and upload two professional letters of recommendation. Letters of recommendation should include name, relationship to applicant, best contact number and email. At least one letter of recommendation must be a professional relationship such as manager, co-worker, or client. Please note that incomplete applications will not be forwarded to the review committee. We look forward to hearing from you and learning more about your achievements, goals, and involvement in the local community. more...

The decision is made by the dean of the Seidel School. more...

The essay should address the applicant’s financial need. Student interviews will be conducted by the scholarship selection committee. Scholarship recipient must attend alumni association meeting during the fall semester in order to receive spring portion of scholarship award. more...

Fire And Rescue Service Survivors Educational Scholarship
Salisbury University and the Salisbury Fire Department have announced a scholarship opportunity in support for the surviving legal dependents of fire and rescue personnel. Scholarships are awarded to surviving legal dependents of the 343 members of the New York City Fire Department killed in the line of duty on September 11, 2001, or any surviving dependent of a Maryland, Delaware, or Virginia fire/rescue member killed in the line of duty or; any dependent of an active, retired, or life members of the Salisbury Fire Department. Scholarships will be awarded to students attending Salisbury University either on a full or part-time basis, regardless of academic concentration. Scholarships will be offered on an annual basis, based on availability of funds, and are renewable.
All undergraduate students may be recommended to apply to this scholarship opportunity because we do not filter any initial eligibility requirements on the General Application. Please read the requirements and determine if you meet these minimum qualifications more...

The First Generation scholarship will be awarded to students whose disadvantaged background deters the pursuit of educational plans in business, science, education or the arts. Available to a first generation student that shows potential for overcoming personal obstacles for higher education; $1,000 per year, renewable if student maintains cumulative 2.5 GPA. Must show financial need from FAFSA.

First Peoples Community Federal Credit Union
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Tri-State area, have at least a 3.0 GPA, and be enrolled in Accounting, Business Administration, Computer Information Systems, Economics, or General Studies to prepare for pursuing a course of study at a four-year institution in Accounting, Business, Communications, Computer Technology, Economics, Finance, or Marketing. Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Preference given to a student who has demonstrated community involvement and shows a creative, forward looking interest that will lead to the betterment (enhancement) of the individual and ultimately the community. Applicant must be of good moral character—cannot have been suspended from high school for any substance abuse nor can he/she have been convicted of substance abuse or have a criminal record. Applicant must have a pattern or track record of working—Christmas and spring breaks or summer (reference must be made of this on application). Applicant must be a member in good standing of First Peoples Community Federal Credit Union (if you or members of your immediate family are members, state on application). Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Preference given to a student who has demonstrated community involvement and shows a creative, forward looking interest that will lead to the betterment (enhancement) of the individual and ultimately the community. Applicant must be of good moral character and cannot have been suspended from high school for any substance abuse nor can he/she have been convicted of substance abuse or have a criminal record. Applicant must have a pattern or track record of working Christmas and spring breaks or summer (reference must be made of this in the essay). Applicant must be a member in good standing of First Peoples Community Federal Credit Union (if you or members of your immediate family are members, you must state this in the essay). Florence Simonds & John B. May Scholarship
The Florence Simonds & John B. May Scholarship is awarded to a Master of Education Reading Specialist candidate. Candidates must have been formally admitted to the REED program, completed at least 2 courses in the program and have a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher. The scholarship is awarded to candidates who evidence academic scholarship and a deep commitment to the teaching of Reading. Providing full elaborate responses to two open-ended questions will enhance your application.Applications will be reviewed and scholarship winners selected by the Scholarship Committee in the Department of Literacy Studies. Award notifications will occur mid-January. more...
