France-Merrick Foundation Endowed Scholarship Fund
The France-Merrick Scholarship is a four year commitment to a student from the Baltimore region who shows an interest in community service. The recipient will be a CCSJ work study intern for their first two years at Loyola, in order to gain exposure to structured community service. After the first two years, the work study component will no longer be a requirement, but the scholarship will stay with the student until graduation. more...

France-Merrick Foundation Scholarship
The France-Merrick Foundation Scholarship has been established to help recruit students from Baltimore City, MD. Eligible students must have attended a Baltimore City high school (public, private or parochial) or transferred from Baltimore City Community College and be a resident of Baltimore City, MD. The scholarship can be renewed for up to 8 semesters if recipient meets the Satisfactory Academic Progress policy and remains enrolled full-time, degree-seeking. more...

Franklin P. Perdue School Of Business Scholarship For Incoming Freshman
The Franklin P. Perdue School of Business awards, on a competitive basis, a number of four-year scholarships based on outstanding scholastic achievement to incoming freshman. Applicants must be an incoming freshman, enrolled full-time with a major in the Perdue School of Business, high school GPA of 3.30 or higher, 1250 SAT/26 ACT or higher and submit written essay. Test optional admitted students must have at least a 3.7 HS GPA or better in order to apply. Recipients must maintain a cumulative GPA of 3.3 or better grade point average, complete at least 30 credits per year and continue to pursue one of the majors in the Perdue School of Business for renewal. more...

Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Gail R. Cartwright Scholarship

Gaithersburg-Germantown Chamber Of Commerce Scholarship
Preference(s) The Gaithersburg -Germantown Chamber of Commerce is providing a $10,000 scholarship gift. Two scholarships ($5,000 each) will be awarded in a given academic year. There are several preferred criteria for the recipient of these scholarships.
-It is preferred that the student be a second year student at Montgomery College (or have completed the equivalent of one academic year)
- It is preferred that the scholarship be awarded to a student studying either engineering or computer science and technologies.
- It is preferred that the student(s) would show a combination of academic achievement, community service, other involvement in the college or community.
- It is preferred that the student have at least a 3.0 grade point average and has other involvement in community service or college activities. more...

Garden Club Of Cumberland Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Cumberland, Maryland who are full-time sophomores, juniors or seniors at Frostburg State University who are majoring in Environmental Analysis & Planning, Earth Sciences, Biology or Wildlife & Fisheries and/or minoring in Environmental Humanities or Environmental Policy. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 CGPA and participate in Garden Club activities. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Geography for more information. more...

The Garland D. and Vivian J. Bull Nursing Scholarship recognizes an academically gifted nursing student who has demonstrated financial need. Minimum qualifications are as follows: financial need as determined by the FAFSA and two letters of recommendation (at least one of which must be from a nursing faculty member).The Student Policies Committee selects recipients of the scholarship, awarded annually for the following academic year. Information is available from the Department of Nursing. more...

Gasper & Rose T. Digiovanna Geriatric Nursing Scholarship Endowment
This scholarship is awarded to a 1st degree junior or senior level nursing major who demonstrates a sincere interest in caring for elders, as well as, a caring, compassionate and sensitive manner with older adults and their families. Minimum qualifications include demonstrating a high likelihood of successfully completing the nursing program and subsequently working with the geriatric population as a professional nurse. Those meeting the requirements must submit a scholarship application form and a letter of recommendation from a nursing faculty member verifying the student’s interest in geriatric nursing as a career. The Nursing Student Policies Committee selects the recipient each year. This scholarship can be renewed for a second year if awarded as a junior. more...

Gateway Travel Plaza
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full- or part-time student, no residency requirement, have at least a 3.0 GPA. $500 scholarship awarded to a student who is a current employee of Gateway Travel Plaza for at least one year or has an immediate family member who is a current employee of Gateway Travel Plaza. Student must be enrolled in a class/curriculum directly relating to the travel/hospitality industry (Hotel/Restaurant Management or Culinary Arts). $250 scholarship awarded to a student who is a current employee of Gateway Travel Plaza for at least one year or has an immediate family member who is a current employee of Gateway Travel Plaza. Student enrolled in any Associate Degree program. Applicant must have completed at least one semester with at least a 3.0 GPA. Money to be used for tuition only — no cash disbursements. Continuation of scholarship into the second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met the criteria. more...

George Weide Jr. Scholarship In History At The Nabb Research Center Of Delmarva History And Culture
The George Weide Jr. Scholarship will provide scholarship funding to a current student pursuing an undergraduate degree in history, with research at The Edward H. Nabb Research Center for Delmarva History and Culture. The recipient is selected by the History Department student honors and awards committee. Selection criteria include: full time enrollment (12 credits or more); minimum 3.5 cumulative GPA. Additionally, applicants must either: 1.) have completed and written a research essay using resources in the Edward H. Nabb Research Center for Delmarva History & Culture* (minimum 1,500 word essay) OR 2.) Have developed a research proposal including a comprehensive description of the research project, list of primary sources and detailed timeline of completion (minimum 400 word count outline). Current SU Students only need to complete either the research essay or research proposal and not both.
*Completed research papers may be submitted from past Salisbury University courses or semesters. more...

The Gerald and Bette Jane Patt Scholarship is available to an incoming freshman majoring in theater. Applicants must have a 3.0 cumulative high school GPA. In addition applicants must submit a letter of recommendation from someone at the high school level that can attest to their abilities in theater. The recipient may qualify for scholarship renewal if appropriate academic standards, including a cumulative 3.0 GPA, are met. Gilpin - Helen A. Gilpin Memorial Vietnam Veterans
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Four-State area, and have at least a 3.0 GPA. Gilpin - The Gilpin Freshman Award
The Gilpin Freshman Award provides tuition assistance to students who meet the following requirements.
Must be a graduate of a high school located in Allegany County, Maryland.
Must have earned a cumulative high school grade point average of at least 3.5.
Must have begun full-time studies at ACM within two years of high school graduation.
Must be considered a college freshman (one who has earned fewer than 28 college credits).
Must not have been previously enrolled full-time at another college or university. more...

Gold Freshmen Merit Award - Coppin State University
The Gold Freshmen Merit Award is awarded to first-time, full-time freshmen at Coppin State University . To qualify for this award, you must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.5 and a minimum combined SAT score of 950, and your CSU placement exam must indicate that no more than one refresher course is required. This award is renewable for up to eight semesters. more...

Gold Transfer Merit Award - Coppin State University
The Gold Transfer Merit Award is awarded to transfer students at Coppin State University. To qualify for this award, you must transfer from a community college with a minimum 2.5 GPA and a minimum SAT score of 950 to be eligible for this award. This award is renewable for up to four semesters. more...

Golden Eagle Scholarship - Coppin State University
The Golden Eagle Scholarship is open to incoming freshmen students at Coppin State University. You must have at least a 3.2 GPA and a minimum SAT score of 1820 to be eligible for this award. more...

Gootee Scholarship
The Gootee Scholarship will provide financial support for student scholarships and academic study to incoming or current students pursuing an undergraduate degree in the Department of Mathematical Sciences and the Department of Computer Science. All mathematics, computer science or data science majors are eligible for this scholarship. The committee will take into consideration the applicant’s cumulative GPA, major GPA, financial need from FAFSA, enthusiasm, work ethic and academic drive. This is a non-renewable scholarship. more...

Graduate & Professional Scholarship Program
Scholarship for Maryland residents who are graduate students enrolled part- or full-time at the University of Maryland, Baltimore (UMB) Schools of Medicine, Dentistry, Law, Pharmacy, or Social Work; University of Baltimore School of Law; The Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine; The Virginia-Maryland Regional College of Veterinary Medicine. Students must have financial need. A FAFSA must be submitted. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Full-time undergraduate Juniors or Seniors who are residents of Maryland;
Currently enrolled in the College of Business and Economics;
Finance majors in the Financial Planning track;
3.0 cumulative GPA or better;
Financial need as defined by the Financial Aid Office; and
Submit required essay. more...

Grillo Family Fellowship
Created in 2012 by the Grillo Family, this fund provides financial aid support for graduate students in the School of Education working with faculty on research and scholarship. more...

Growing Academic Potential- Aces Scholarship
The scholarship will support:
1. Full-time students in the ACES program who:
2. Are registered during fall and intend to earn their AA degree in two-three years;
3. Transfer immediately to a BA/BS degree program offered at the Universities at Shady Grove to be completed in the next two years;
4. Are in good standing within the ACES program, including school attendance, ACES program participation, and a mid-range grade point average between 2.0 and 3.2 when accepted as a first-year scholarship recipient;
5.Are from families who qualify for FARMS (Free and Reduced Meals) or have other documented evidence of financial need;
6. Have submitted the FAFSA financial aid form on time and received all the federal/state and local grants they are eligible for that year;
7. Share his/her written statement of their aspirations and their educational and career goals.
8. If a scholarship recipient elects to withdraw from the ACES program, the student forfeits their future scholarship awards. more...

This scholarship was established by the Hattie M. Strong Foundation for candidates who: are in their final year of study; have exhibited outstanding success and enthusiasm in field experience; demonstrate financial need; and have achieved a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA in the two semesters prior to their final year. Candidates must submit: (1) a statement on the attributes and experiences you will bring to the profession that define you as young educators of promise; and (2) a reference letter from your mentor teacher describing your strengths based on your field experience performance to the Scholarship /Awards Committee in the Seidel School of Education. Please contact the Seidel School, Education Department for more information on this scholarship. more...

Healthcare Initiative Foundation Adn -To Bsn Nursing Scholarship
This award provides scholarship support of $1,500 each academic year for students accepted into MC’s nursing program who intend to earn their bachelor’s degree in nursing through the ADN-to-BSN dual admission program at the Universities at Shady Grove (USG). Bilingual students are particularly encouraged to apply, but this opportunity is open to any nursing student who meets the criteria.
Additional benefits for recipients will include healthcare interpreting certification or cultural communications training, as well as participation in an annual hands-on interprofessional collaboration activity with students in other healthcare fields.
The Healthcare Initiative Foundation scholarships are structured to provide ongoing support to recipients during your studies at Montgomery College and at the Universities at Shady Grove through completion of your bachelor’s degree, as long as you continue to meet the criteria.
CRITERIA
1. Need based;
2. Montgomery County resident;
3. Student already accepted or enrolled in MC’s nursing program with the intent to enroll in the ADN-to-BSN dual admission program with the University of Maryland School of Nursing at the Universities at Shady Grove;
4. Meets the eligibility requirements for the Dual Enrollment nursing program, including an overall GPA of at least 3.0 and a science GPA of at least 2.75
5. Must commit to an internship/clinical rotation at a nonprofit (or hospital); and maintain academic standing in their degree program. more...

Healthcare Initiative Foundation Building Career Pathways Scholarship
This award provides scholarship support of $1,500 each academic year, and a $200 living stipend each semester, for behavioral health/mental health and public health students who intend to earn their bachelor’s degree in social work or public health at the Universities at Shady Grove (USG). Bilingual students are particularly encouraged to apply, but this opportunity is open to any student who meets the criteria.
Additional benefits for recipients will include career preparation through the CEO program operated by USG, as well as participation in the annual Mass Casualty Drill at MC or a similar collaboration activity with students in other healthcare fields. We ask applicants to plan to participate in both activities.
The Healthcare Initiative Foundation scholarships are structured to provide ongoing support to recipients during your studies at Montgomery College and at the Universities at Shady Grove through completion of your bachelor’s degree, as long as you continue to meet the criteria.
CRITERIA
1. Montgomery County resident;
2. In need of financial assistance;
3. Behavioral health or public health major, completing the mental health major, or enrolled in an introductory behavioral health course during 2021-2022;
4. Intends to pursue bachelor’s degree in social work or public health at The Universities at Shady Grove;
5. Must commit to an internship/clinical rotation at a nonprofit (or hospital); and
6. Maintain academic standing in their degree program. more...

Healthcare Initiative Foundation Community Healthcare Nursing Scholarship
This scholarship offers a fourth-semester award of $1,500 to 10 nursing students who are willing to participate in a leadership clinical rotation experience at a safety-net clinic that serves uninsured residents. Recipients also will receive $300 to pay for their NCLEX exam when they register. more...

Healthcare Initiative Foundation Nursing Scholarship
1) Need based;
2) Montgomery County resident;
3) Student already accepted or enrolled in MC’s nursing program;
4) Must commit to an internship/clinical rotation at a nonprofit (or hospital) and maintain academic standing in their degree program;
5) Preference either for students in the ACES program or
6) Any candidate who is the first generation of his/her family to attend college. more...

This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student (students are considered “full-time” for ACM Foundation scholarships if they are enrolled in the clinical phase of a two-year, associate degree Allied Health program for eight or more credit hours.), must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, have at least a 3.0 GPA, and be enrolled in a health career program including Human Service Associate (Integrative Health). The applicant should address why they are applying for the scholarship award and how they will use creative writing and visual art in their coursework and profession. Applicant must have taken or plan to take an art, creative writing, or integrative health course. Heather Clair Miller Memorial Scholarship
The Heather Clair Miller Salisbury University Fund scholarship was created at The Pittsburgh Foundation to provide a four-year, renewable scholarship to at least two student recipients attending Salisbury University who meet minimum entrance requirements. The criteria are as follows: 1.) attend a high school as a graduating senior at/in Wicomico County, MD as the first preference for awarding. During a year that there are no eligible students from Wicomico County, MD, this scholarship may be awarded to graduating high school seniors from Worcester County, Dorchester County and Somerset County, MD. 2.) Have displayed special talent or interest in a particular field of study or activity. 3.) Demonstrate financial need. 4.) Plan to attend Salisbury University. 5.) Be involved in productive extracurricular and/or other activities outside of school which reflect an ordinary (typical) student who shows extraordinary self-discipline and motivation to goals larger than self. 6.) Preference will be given to students who may be challenged in their academic pursuits because of her rural and/or nigh need status. more...

Herson - Stirman Family Aces Pathway Champions Scholarship
Supports students who meet the criteria below and will be renewable for up to three years until completion of his/her Associates Degree.
1. First year participant in ACES program at Montgomery College and intends to earn an associate’s degree within two-three years
2. Demonstrates Financial Need
3. Plans to transfer immediately to BA/BS degree program offered at the Universities at Shady Grove to be completed in the next two years and remain in good academic standing
4. GPA of 2.5 or greater
5. Dream Act or DACA students are eligible
The same recipient(s) will continue to receive this scholarship at MC and USG, as long as they meet the criteria. If a scholarship recipient elects to withdraw from the ACES program or if he/she transfers to a program not housed at the USG campus, then the student forfeits their future scholarship awards. more...

Higher Education Emergency Relief Fund Iii (Heerf Iii) - Student Emergency Grant Funds
As of midnight Thursday 2/24/22 ALL funding has been exhausted, NO NEW APPLICATIONS WILL BE ACCEPTED FOR SPRING 2022
The Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2021 included additional COVID-19 relief through the Coronavirus Response and Relief Supplemental Appropriations (CRRSA) Act. This funding is available through the Higher Education Emergency Relief Fund III (HEERF III) created by the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act.
Salisbury University has received additional Federal HEEFR III funding for the Spring 2022 semester. Application process will begin here on 2/7/22 and run for two weeks until 2/20/22 OR until all funding has been exhausted! Be advised that the application process may close prior to 2/20/22 if all funding has been exhausted for spring
These emergency grants will assist currently enrolled (spring 2022) SU students experiencing financial hardships with expenses related to:
Any component of your cost of attendance such as tuition, fees, food, housing, books and supplies, transportation and personal expenses.
Other emergency cost or expenses that arise due to the Coronavirus, such as, but not limited to, computer and internet service, health care and child care.
Who is Eligible for the SU Emergency HEERF III Grant?
*A student must meet all criteria listed to qualify:
*A student who is currently enrolled in an SU degree or certificate program for spring 2022 semester.
Who is Not Eligible for the SU Emergency HEERF III Grant?
*Students enrolled in a non-degree program.
*Students that are enrolled in dual and/or concurrent courses (High school).
*Students who have already withdrawn from all spring 2022 classes.
*Students who are admitted for fall 2022
*Students enrolled in UMUC Kaiserslautern-Kapaun (Germany)
Apply for HEERF III Grant:
Students need to apply using the SU Emergency HEERF III Grant application included here.
*Requests for emergency grant assistance will be reviewed by the SU Office of Financial Aid & Scholarships.
*Please allow up to *14 business days to receive an email response from our office regarding the status of your application.
*Students may be asked to provide additional information or documentation to support their request.
*Funding is limited and not all requests will be granted.
*The maximum amount a student can request is $2,500 combined from fall 2021 and spring 2022. Example – if you received $1,500 HEERF funding for fall 2021 you may only request $1,000 for spring 2022.
*Applications will continue to be reviewed until funding has been exhausted. Not everyone who applies for funding will be awarded. You may not receive the full amount of funding you have requested for spring. more...

Preference is given to students who have not attended high school or college in the past 20 years. more...

Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and demonstrate participation in the community and church. Number of awards may vary. more...

Hill - Kate Dailey Hill Memorial

Home Ground
Home Ground is a volunteer organization in Allegany County whose mission is to increase knowledge of Allegany County’s natural assets, inspiring citizens to support sustainable use and conservation of our land and water resources. This scholarship will be awarded for the Fall semester to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, resident of Tri-State area, have at least a 3.0 GPA, and be enrolled in the Biology, Forest Technology, or Tree Care Technician curriculum. Applicant must submit a brief essay (no more than one page) explaining his/her plan of study, how he/she would use the money, and how it coincides with the goals of Home Ground. The awardee will be expected to meet with the Home Ground organization after the semester to present a talk about his/her work and study, which may lead to a letter of recommendation if needed by the student. The award may be used towards tuition, cost of a field studies trip in biology or geology, independent study, or study abroad. The applicant’s work could be tied to a service learning project. A one-time continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Homer Gudelsky Memorial Award
The Homer Gudelsky Memorial Award is available to freshman undergraduate students at Capitol Technology University. You must demonstrate commitment and potential for academic success to be eligible for this award. more...

Ifc Fraternity Man Scholarship: 1,000 Words For $1,000
Requirements:
• Must attend Salisbury University
• Must be an active member of an IFC fraternity
• Must have at least a 2.5 cumulative GPA
• Please attach resume
• Submitted by December 1st, 2021
Inter-Fraternity Council is an intermediate, neutral party for fraternal activities and issues. We promote the values of brotherhood, scholarship, service, leadership, and citizenship, all while helping to maintain healthy inter-fraternity relations. This award is designed to embody the value of scholarship within the chapters of IFC. In at least 1000 words, describe what it means to be a fraternity man. Please speak on how you promote brotherhood, scholarship, service, leadership, and citizenship as a brother of your organization. Consider what expectations you had prior to joining, why you opted to join a fraternity, and how your experience in your organization has molded you into a fraternity man. For questions, please contact JP Dixon at jdixon10@gulls.salisbury.edu. This scholarship will be awarded for spring semester. more...

Institute For Retired Persons (Irp) Scholarship
The Institute for Retired Persons (IRP) provides up to three Salisbury University students scholarships for the upcoming academic year. Minimum eligibility requirements include: full-time senior status for the upcoming award period; cumulative GPA 2.80; financial need from the FAFSA and short essay. Open to all majors. This is a non-renewable scholarship but you may reapply.
The Institute for Retired Persons is designed for adults aged 50 and above and offers programs to enlighten, educate and promote a better understanding of our world. The members meet every Tuesday at 2 pm during the University’s fall and spring semesters at the Ward Museum of Wildfowl Art. Recipients of the scholarship will be invited to attend the first IRP meeting of the fall semester in September to be formally recognized by the organization. Selected recipients should make every effort to attend the IRP meeting in September. more...

Irving And Sylvia Cort Scholarship
The Irving and Sylvia Cort Scholarship in chemistry was established by Bruce Cort in honor of his parents, Irving and Sylvia Cort. The award is given annually to chemistry majors based on academic excellence in high school. Generally, a student needs a minimum combined SAT/ACT score of 1200/25 and a high school academic GPA of 3.3 to be considered (exceptions can be made) and a declared major in Chemistry. This scholarship is awarded for a maximum of four years provided the student is full-time, maintains a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 and makes satisfactory progress toward a chemistry degree. In addition, each scholarship recipient will be named a Chemistry Department Research Fellow and receive a grant of $250 per year to support student-faculty research. For a student to maintain “Satisfactory Progress towards a Chemistry Degree” he/she must finish Chem 121, Chem 122, and Math 201 with a grade of C or better by the end of the first year, Chem 221, Chem 222, and Math 202 with grades of C or better by the end of the second year, and Chem 341 or CHEM 342 along with a year of physics with grades of C or better by the end of the third year. The research grant cannot be carried over from one year to the next. Student-faculty research must be conducted with a full-time tenure track faculty member from the Department of Chemistry or related department with the Department of Chemistry approval. more...

Irwin Foundation Scholarship (Current Use)
Created by the Irwin Foundation in 2017, this scholarship is awarded to a first-year student, and will be available to the same student over the course of their four years at Loyola. more...

Ivan & Charlotte Hall Scholarship (B)
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Allegany College of Maryland. Students must have a minimum 2.0 CGPA, a minimum 3.0 GPA in Chemistry 101, be enrolled in Chemistry 102, and be U.S. citizens/permanent residents. Number of awards may vary. more...

Jared Young Music Scholarship
The Jared Young Music Scholarship memorializes Jared who graduated from Salisbury University in 2011 and was a gifted guitarist and musician. The recipient of this scholarship will be recommended by the adjudicators of the students who have been accepted into the music program at Salisbury University by performance. The chosen student will have exceptional talent. First preference by audition will be a guitar music major. Student must demonstrate financial need from the FAFSA. The scholarship may be renewable if recipient is approved by the Co-Chair of Music and meets the criteria. Contact the Department of Music to arrange an audition. more...

Supports students who are:
1. Present or former members of the Mid-Atlantic International Home Furnishings Representatives (IHFRA);
2. Siblings or children of the same (IHFRA) who are interested in a career in interior design (either in the development, manufacture or business component of the home furnishings industry);
3. Demonstrate financial need;
4. Consideration may be given to any individual, sibling or child of anyone employed in any capacity in the home furnishing industry, wholesale, retail, commercial, specifier, distributor involved in the sale or specifier of upholstery, case goods, accessories, bedding, rugs, etc. may be considered for this scholarship;
5. Students enrolled in the Interior Design Associate of Applied Science curriculum. more...

Joan Durham King Travel Abroad Scholarship
This scholarship is for the 2022/2023 academic year.
This scholarship is open to students traveling abroad and admitted international students, who demonstrate a commitment to diversity and equity. All applicants must meet the following requirements:
Full-time undergraduate in their Sophomore or Junior year in Academic Year 2022/2023;
Participating in a TU Study Abroad Program or enrolled at TU on a F1 visa as an international student;
3.0 cumulative GPA or higher; and
Submit the required essay.
Preference given to members of the Students Achieve Goals through Education (SAGE) program, a participant of Black Student Union, or a fraternity or sorority member within the National Pan-Hellenic Council. more...

John K. Knowles Foreign Study Scholarship
The John K. Knowles Foreign Study Scholarship was established by Dr. John Knowles (SU Spanish faculty 1971-1997) in order to expand study abroad opportunities for students studying a foreign language at SU. This scholarship expands study abroad opportunities for students studying a foreign language at Salisbury University. Students must be at the sophomore rank or above, provide evidence of financial need from FAFSA and submit an application which describes their personal and academic goals and how they will be met by a study abroad experience. Preference will be given to study abroad experiences that will fulfill academic requirements foreign language majors and minors. They are further expected to participate in related departmental activities upon their return to campus. The number of scholarships will vary, depending on the availability of funds. Information is available from the Department of Modern Languages and Intercultural Studies. Scholarship recipients are encouraged to keep the Knowles fund alive by donating to the Knowles Scholarship Fund through the Salisbury University Foundation in the future. Submitted applications for this scholarship must be complete with well written essays. Note that cutting and pasting content from websites is considered plagiarism. Pay attention to grammar, vocabulary, punctuation and spelling! If you are unsure of the quality of your application, please visit the Writing Center for help. This application is for study abroad programs for Winter 2023 or Spring 2023 ONLY more...

Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and participate in extracurricular/community activities. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. Contact the Department of Educational Professions for more information. more...

John O'neill Memorial Endowed Scholarship
1. Awards shall be for the purposes of tuition, fees, books, and/or supplies.
2. Student recipients shall be U.S. citizens who reside in Montgomery County at the time of the award and have financial need.
3. Student recipients shall attend Montgomery College, taking credit courses in pursuit of a degree.
4. Student recipients shall have and maintain a minimum GPA of 2.0.
5. Eligible applicants shall be identified by one of two criteria, in the following priority order: completion of the Gateway to College program (high school diploma) or by having earned a GED certificate (high school diploma equivalency).
6. If there are no eligible applicants who meet the immediately preceding criteria, then awards shall be made to any applicant who is enrolling in the fire science and emergency services program or, if there are still no eligible applicants, then to any applicant enrolling in the health sciences. more...

Jordan Feder Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Jordan Feder ’02 was an active student at Towson University who majored in Art. He was a member of the Mascot squad and was known for his political activism on campus. He passed away on November 26, 2003, several days after serving as a medic helping injured protestors during a free trade meeting in Miami. Jordan’s family members, Alan and Michele Feder, were founding members of the former Parents Association.
Preference will be given to students whose family members have an active membership with the Towson Family Network.
Please note that non-Family Network members can still apply and will be considered for the award. more...

Joseph And Anna G. Seidel Scholarship
The Joseph and Anna G. Seidel Scholarship provides financial assistance to students from the lower Eastern Shore, MD (Wicomico, Worcester and Somerset counties) who are members of either the Beth Israel Congregation in Salisbury, MD or the Bat Yam Congregation in Ocean City, MD (first preference). First consideration for funding is also given to an incoming freshman. Additional eligibility requirements include: 3.0 cumulative high school GPA, ranking in the top 25% of the high school class and enrollment for a minimum of 15 credits per semester at Salisbury University. A recipient may retain the scholarship for a maximum of 4 years provided he/she has a minimum 3.0 cumulative grade point average at Salisbury University and has successfully completed 15 credit hours per term. Interested students should contact the Financial Aid Office and provide documentation certifying their affiliation with one of the above congregations if applicable. Scholarship may be canceled if the 15 credit per semester requirement is not fulfilled.
All undergraduate students are recommended to apply to this scholarship opportunity because we do not filter any eligibility requirements on the General Application. more...

This Mulligan scholarship was created to provide scholarship opportunities to a student in the Henson School of Science & Technology for the following majors: Physics, Biology, Computer Science, Data Science or Mathematics. Students must have financial need from the FAFSA. Open to any grade level, preference to current students, and may be renewed if student continues to meet scholarship criteria and funding is available. more...

Joseph W.T. And Hannah C. Smith Memorial Scholarship
The Joseph W.T. and Hannah C. Smith Memorial Scholarship recognizes nursing students who are academically gifted and demonstrate outstanding potential for a career in nursing. Minimum applicant qualifications include: a declared major in pre-nursing, maintenance of full-time status (enrolled for a minimum of 12 credit hours per semester and complete 24 credits per academic year) throughout four years of the nursing program, and maintenance of an GPA of 2.5 each academic semester as a declared pre-nursing or nursing major. The scholarship will be awarded annually to an entering freshman for a maximum of eight academic semesters. The scholarship award is up to $2,500 per year for four academic years. more...

Justin Mcjilton Memorial Scholarship
The Justin McJilton Memorial Scholarship was established to provide a fitting and meaningful memorial to Justin McJilton. Justin was an active student at Salisbury University in the Perdue School of Business. He was an avid supporter and fundraiser for the American Cancer Society and twice co-chaired the Salisbury University Relay for Life. Justin passed away in 2009 at the age of 23 from complications associated with leukemia. To honor his memory, the scholarship was established to provide support for current students whose lives have been touched by cancer. The scholarship will be awarded to a current student of promise at Salisbury University who has a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.50 and is enrolled full-time. This scholarship is open to any undergraduate major at SU. A 250 word essay is required describing how your life has been touched by cancer. This is a non-renewable scholarship opportunity. more...

Justin Shen Endowment For International Studies Majors- Study Abroad
The Justin Shen Endowment for International Studies majors is a stipend given annually each fall to assist in covering the cost of a study abroad experience during the following calendar year. The scholarship decision is based on cumulative GPA, an application essay, and financial need from FAFSA. more...

Justin Shen Political Science And International Studies Senior Awards
As part of the Justin Y. Shen Endowment at Salisbury University there will be two awards made each spring as part of the Shen Political Science Award and the Shen International Studies Award. Each of these awards will recognize an outstanding graduating senior in their respective major of study. Award recipients must be a political science or international studies major with at least a 3.0 cumulative GPA. Additional information can be obtained from the department. One student from each of the two majors is chosen in the spring and recognized at Honors Convocation. Recipients may also be selected from fall semester . Award amounts will be of equal value when funding is sufficient. Contact the Departments for additional information. more...

K & L Microwave, Inc. Scholarship Program At Salisbury University
The K & L Microwave, Inc. Scholarship Program at Salisbury University provides scholarship funding to junior and senior level students majoring in math, computer science, data science, physics, chemistry or information systems. Students must be full-time and have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0. The scholarship program provides $3,000 in funding for both the junior and senior year with a 20 hour per week, 10-week paid internship with K & L Microwave, Inc. during the summer between the junior and senior year. The paid internship provides an additional $3,000 in funding making the full benefit of the program $9,000 per recipient. The selection process for the scholarship is handled through the Henson School of Science and Technology. Please visit the K&L Microwave website for more information and to learn more about K&L Microwave. more...

Knisley - Robert W. Knisley Memorial

Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

The Knott Scholarships is open to incoming first year catholic students at the College of Notre Dame of Maryland. You must be residing within the Archdiocese of Baltimore who have the highest levels academic excellence and consistent display of leadership and service to be eligible for this award. more...

Seniors must have a minimum 2.8 in Education courses. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Educational Professions for more information. more...

Krug - Vincent G. Krug Memorial

Applicant must have completed 28 or more total credit hours (at any college or university) at the time the scholarship begins. more...

Lashbaugh - William F. Lashbaugh, Jr. Memorial
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full- or part-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Allegany County, have at least a 3.0 GPA, and be enrolled in the Criminal Justice curriculum. Applicant must have no prior criminal record or drug abuse. Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Lawrence H. And Thelma H. Ey Memorial Scholarship
The Lawrence H. and Thelma H. Ey Memorial Scholarship will provide financial support to a freshman, sophomore or junior level student who meets the following criteria: full-time undergraduate with intent to declare or current major in Business, Nursing or Education; minimum cumulative GPA of 2.75 or higher/freshman applicants minimum high school GPA of 3.00 or higher; Essay on the topic – Please explain why you believe you should receive this scholarship and why did you chose your major? The scholarship can be renewed for two additional years (6 semesters total) if eligibility criteria continue to be met. more...

Leland Starnes Memorial Scholarship
Dr. Leland Starnes served as Director of the Salisbury State Theatre from 1972 to 1980. The Leland Starnes Scholarship will provide funding to current and future students in the Fulton School of Liberal Arts. It will be granted to a theatre major who has demonstrated promise in growth as an artist, whose pursuit of excellence is foremost and whose habits reflect professionalism. Eligible students must be full-time sophomore or junior with a declared theater major, cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher, demonstrate merit through performance review and provide a personal statement describing the student’s background and participation in theatre. Scholarships are one-time non-renewable. more...

Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Division of Performing Arts-Theatre for more information. more...

Leonard - Kim And Marion Leonard Scholarship For Integrative Health And Authentic Leadership
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full- or part-time student, resident of Allegany County, MD; Somerset or Bedford County, PA; or Mineral County, WV, and have at least a 3.25 GPA. Available to credit or CE students who have demonstrated an interest in integrative health and/or mind-body-wellness medicine and who desire to further develop mind body skills that stress personal awareness, with focus on self-acceptance, compassion, authenticity, and self-responsibility. Applicants should address what experiences or training they have had in this area, as well as how they plan to take a leadership role that would further the integration of mind-body-wellness skills into their professional career. Continuing education students should address their commitment to the coursework and their plan to attend a minimum of 80% of the course sessions. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Lucy Tull Scholarship
The Lucy Tull Scholarship provides funding for students pursuing degrees in medically related fields. Scholarships may include full funding for tuition, room, board, books and fees and are renewable throughout the student’s undergraduate studies for eight semesters. Freshman applicants, upper class transfer students from Wor-Wic Community College and current first degree Salisbury University students who are permanent residents of Wicomico, Worcester, or Somerset County, MD are eligible for consideration. Candidates must have a required major within College of Health and Human Services or the Henson School and pursue a career in nursing, clinical laboratory science, respiratory therapy, or be planning on a career in medicine, dentistry, physical therapy, optometry, pharmacy, public health or other health care professions. Candidates may also be a Biology or Chemistry Secondary Education major. Priority will be given to those studying Nursing. Tull Scholarship recipients are not guaranteed acceptance into professional programs that require formal admission. Eligible entering freshmen, transfer students and currently enrolled Salisbury University students can begin applying Dec 1st for the upcoming academic year. Scholarship applicants must submit the FAFSA each year soon after October 1st so results will be available by the scholarship application deadline. Financial need from the FAFSA is required. Documents submitted by freshmen and transfer applicants during the admissions process will be available to the Tull Scholarship Committee, whereas, SU academic transcripts will be reviewed for current SU students. Application deadline for all students is February 21st. This scholarship is renewable if you continue to meet the Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) policy SAP Click Here, make adequate progress towards your degree and remain in an eligible major.
Salisbury University is a Division III member of the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) and therefore athletic leadership, ability, participation nor performance can be utilized as a criterion in the determination of your financial aid award. As you apply for scholarships within Salisbury University’s Academic Works scholarship site please do not mention athletic leadership, ability, participation or performance within any required essay as it will remove you from consideration for the award to ensure Salisbury University continued compliance with Bylaw 15.4.1 of the NCAA regulations. more...

Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, be U.S. citizens/permanent residents, and be pursuing a banking career. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

Recipients are awarded as incoming first year Loyola students, with support continuing throughout the recipients’ four-year undergraduate career so long as eligibility is maintained. more...

Mannion Scholarship Endowment
The Mannion Scholarship Endowment will provide a scholarship for a student in the Master of Social Work program at Salisbury University. Recipients must be full-time enrolled in the 2 year master of social work program at the main campus of Salisbury University; must demonstrate financial need from FAFSA; preference given to a Somerset County, MD resident then a Wicomico or Worcester County, MD resident. Students enrolled at various satellite program locations are not eligible for this scholarship. This scholarship can be renewed for a second year if criteria are met and funding is available. more...

Margaret Johnson Elmore Nursing Scholarship
The Margaret Johnson Elmore Nursing Scholarship recognizes academically gifted pre-nursing/nursing majors who demonstrate potential for professional nursing leadership and service. Criteria for eligibility are “scholastic ability” first and “financial need” second. Recipients must maintain an Salisbury University GPA of 2.5 each academic year. Priority is given first to full-time freshman pre-nursing majors (recipients must be granted and accept admission to the nursing program for the first semester of their junior year to maintain scholarship eligibility; receipt of said scholarship does not ensure admission to the nursing program); second to full-time junior nursing majors admitted to the nursing program; and third to full-time senior nursing majors in the final year of the nursing program. The committee awards scholarships annually for up to four years. Information is available from the Department of Nursing. Candidates must be from Accomack or North Hampton counties in VA. A HS GPA of 3.0 is required to be eligible as well as academic merit. more...

Marguerite Witwer Richards Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students at Frostburg State University who participate in the schools music program. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 CGPA and have musical talent. Nonrenewable. Contact the Division of Performing Arts-Music for more information. more...

Marie A. Cavallaro Art Scholarship
The Marie A. Cavallaro Art scholarship is meant to recognize student leadership and involvement, specifically in the visual arts. The applicant must be a full time Art major, with a 3.0 or better GPA. The applicant will submit a portfolio of student work, and a personal statement describing his or her background and participation in art. The student must also provide evidence of using art in a leadership or volunteer role on campus or in the community. one letter or recommendation speaking to this leadership or volunteer activity required. This is a non-renewable scholarship but students can reapply each year. more...

Marie Calafiura Scholarship
This Calafiura scholarship is awarded to an accounting major for his/her final one or two semesters of study. The student must have completed, or be in the process of completing at time of application, the following courses: 2 principles courses, 2 intermediate courses, and 1 elective accounting course. The student must maintain a minimum of a 2.8 overall cumulative GPA, with a minimum 3.0 GPA in all accounting courses. The most recent completed semester’s GPA will be utilized. Interested applicants must apply to obtain consideration for this scholarship. more...

Marie Walsh Sharpe Foundation Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Maryland Institute, College of Art. Applicants must have participated in the MWSF Summer Program. Renewable. more...

Marilyn Seidel Nursing Scholarship
The Marilyn Seidel Nursing Scholarship recognizes an academically gifted nursing student who has demonstrated outstanding potential for nursing leadership and service. Minimum qualifications include the following: cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher; nursing major; a self-evaluation of potential for professional leadership and service; and three letters of recommendation, at least one of which must be from a nursing faculty member. The Student Policies Committee selects recipients of the scholarship, awarded for up to two years. Information is available from the Department of Nursing. more...

Marine Corps League - Somerset Detachment # 660
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student during the fall semester who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full- or part-time student, resident of Somerset County, have at least a 2.0 GPA, and state financial need in scholarship essay as well as apply for financial aid. Applicants whose father, mother, or guardian is a member in good standing of the Department of Pennsylvania Marine Corps League or Auxiliary will be given preferential consideration. Applicant must attend the Somerset County Campus. more...

Knott, Baltimore businessman and philanthropist, and they are named in honor of his wife. These scholarships are four-year, full-tuition awards available on a competitive basis to Catholic students residing in the Archdiocese of Baltimore. more...

Marshall W Moore Scholarship
The Marshall Moore Scholarship’s purpose is to create a scholarship in perpetuity for a student with financial need from FAFSA. Preference is given to non-traditional students who will be a junior or senior grade level for the upcoming academic year. Eligible students must submit, via the SU Scholarship Website – Academic Works, a letter of recommendation from a Salisbury University faculty member along with a biographical essay, 250-300 words, which includes their activities while at Salisbury University and plans for the future. The scholarship may be continued for senior year if recipients maintain a cumulative 3.0 GPA. more...

Martha T. & Ralph M. Race History Scholarship

The purpose of the Mary and Sigmund Hyman Scholarship Fund shall be to provide one or more scholarships each year to Loyola students majoring in the Natural and Applied Sciences. Loyola shall give preference to students who demonstrate a moderate level of financial need based on Loyola’s then current need-analysis methodology. This purpose shall govern the fund regardless of prior designation criteria. more...

Mary Ann Reinhold-Praley was a teacher/administrator for 30 years in the Maryland public school system. The purpose of this scholarship provides funding for books and other expenses incurred by students who are admitted in the Teacher Education program and subsequently will be teaching in the Maryland public school system. Eligible students must be in good standing in the Seidel School for Education and must meet the following criteria: teacher education major, cumulative 3.0 GPA or better and financial need from FAFSA. This is a one-time scholarship. more...

Maryland Society Of Accountants
The Maryland Society of Accountants Scholarship Foundation, Inc was established to provide scholarships to promising undergraduate students majoring in accounting. Each fall the Foundation awards annual scholarships in the amount of $2,000 for full time students, and $1,000 for part-time students (not to exceed $8000.00 per recipient).
Applicants who are selected will receive one half of the scholarship each semester. The second installment is dependent on the recipient submitting a semester transcript which shows they have maintained the required academic performance. To apply, students must meet the eligibility requirements listed below, submit the on-line application, and send in the required attachments by June 15. Please note, students should not send official transcripts prior to the Spring semester class grades being posted; any transcript received which does not include the most recent Spring semester grades will not be considered for scholarship!
To be eligible, applicants must:
•Be a Maryland Resident enrolled in an accredited Maryland University, College or Community College
•Have successfully completed Accounting Principles I and II, with a grade of “B” or better.
•Maintain a grade point average of 3.0 or higher in both accounting and overall.
•Be enrolled in a program, with a major in accounting leading to a degree or certificate
•Attend a special recognition ceremony.
RENEWAL OF AWARD:
•The second installment of the scholarship is dependent on the recipient submitting a transcript for fall/winter grades by January 15th which shows they have maintained the required academic performance. Additionally, students selected for a scholarship MUST attend an event to be recognized in order to receive the renewal installment.
To apply, complete the following on-line application by clicking the “visit” button below and submit the required attachments by June 15th. Additional information can be found here: MSA Scholarship Information more...

Maryland State Financial Aid Programs
The Office of Student Financial Assistance (OSFA) at the Maryland Higher Education Commission (MHEC) provides a number of state grants, scholarships, and loan assistance repayment programs for eligible Maryland residents. The State of Maryland has an extensive array of financial aid programs in the form of grants, scholarships and other awards for students who want to further their education beyond high school. Below you will find a link to view a complete listing of programs offered by MHEC, click the “VISIT” Button.
MDCAPS is MHEC’s comprehensive financial aid system that allows us to process State scholarship applications. To use MDCAPS, you must first create a student login profile by:
1. Creating a MDCAPS student log-in. This will create your student account.
2. Click the link in the new activation email you will receive after creating your account
3. Check your spam filter if you do not see the activation email in your inbox
Important: To prevent MHEC emails from going to your spam folder, simply update your email settings to accept emails from the following email address: “donotreply@maryland.gov”
Use this link to sign in or create your MDCAPS account: MDCAPS Sign In Page more...

Annuals award for a graduating high school senior admitted to Maryland Institute, College of Art. Applicant must have demonstrated talent and promise, based on a portfolio of artwork. Selection includes personal character; an inquisitive, open and discerning mind; and an interest in the social and cultural context for making art. Submit high school transcripts, letters of recommendation, and a slide portfolio of 12-20 pieces of original work with application packet. Renewable; maintain 3.0 GPA. more...

Mount Saint Agnes College Scholarship Endowment
The Fund shall be an endowed companion Fund to the existing Mount Saint Agnes College Current Use Scholarship Fund. Scholarships shall be awarded by the Office of Financial Aid to undergraduate students with the first preference for those who are descendants of a Mount Saint Agnes alumna or those who graduated from a Sisters of Mercy affiliated high school. If the first preference cannot be met, the scholarship should be awarded with a secondary preference to a graduate of a Catholic school or to a student with demonstrated financial need. more...

MPOWER offers various scholarships for international students seeking to gain an education in the U.S. or Canada. Many scholarships come with restrictions and entry fees that limit accessibility, but MPOWER created scholarships that are widely accessible to international students. Apply today and begin your future of studying abroad! more...

Music Endowed Pusey Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students at Frostburg State University who participate in the schools music program and play the basson or oboe. Selection based on talent. Preference given to music majors. Nonrenewable. Contact the Division of Performing Arts-Music for more information. more...

Music Ensemble Scholarship
The Music Ensemble Scholarship is available to students at Salisbury University. An audition is required. more...

Music Ensemble Scholarships
The Fulton School of Liberal Arts, Department of Music, offers scholarships each fall and spring semester to students wanting to have some fun singing or playing their instrument in a music ensemble. The Department of Music currently has five large ensembles to choose from and they are open to any student with prior musical experience. All majors from any discipline are eligible for these scholarships provided they agree to remain enrolled in the course and complete all requirements for the duration of the semester. Scholarships will be decided based on an audition. Students interested in applying should contact the Department of Music for additional information. more...

Mylo S. Downey Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Maryland College of Agriculture and Natural Resources. Students must demonstrate financial need. Preference given to students who demonstrate achievement in 4-H club activities. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Myron E. Blough Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for Maryland, Pennsylvania, West Virginia, or Washington, D.C. residents who are undergraduate students enrolled part- or full-time at Allegany College of Maryland. Students must be enrolled in a Pharmacy Technician training course. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

N. Rose Atwood Scholarships
Scholarship for Maryland residents who are incoming freshmen enrolling full-time at Frostburg State University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and minimum SAT score of 1100. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Admissions Office for more information. more...

Nair - Robert L. Nair Memorial
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Four-State area, have at least a 3.0 GPA, and be enrolled in the Occupational Therapy Assistant program. Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Nancy Gibney Binkley Scholarship
Scholarship for gradudates of a Washington County, Maryland high school who are full-time undergraduate students at Frostburg State University that are majoring in Education. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 CGPA. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Educational Professions for more information. more...

Nancy Ginder Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time juniors at Frostburg State University that are majoring in Education. Applicants must have a minimum 3.25 GPA and completed courses 201 and 202. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Educational Professions for more information. more...

Nancy M. And G. Edward Reahl, Jr. Scholarship Fund
This fund, established by G. Edward Reahl, Jr., ’53, serves to foster the opportunity for a college education at Loyola for talented students. more...

Nasa Wallops Flight Facility Summer Internship Opportunity
The Wallops Electrical Engineering Branch at Wallops Flight Facility (WFF) is responsible for the conception, analysis, design, development, validation, and implementation of flight electrical/electronics, communications and tracking, and electrical ground support systems for our missions, projects, and technology initiatives. WFF is seeking motivated accomplished students who can juggle multiple assignments, learn quickly, remain flexible and communicate well for a 10-week summer internship. The specific project activities will be determined closer to the start of the internship. Prior internship projects have included optimization of engineering tools and applications, brainstorming solutions to difficult problems, digital design, development of electronic schematics and drawings, antenna testing, support of rocket launch activities, integration and ground testing of major flight hardware, and data analysis. Often project work will span a range of design, analysis, fabrication, and test arena during the internship. more...

Nathan Foundation Scholarship
The Nathan Foundation was created following the instructions in the will of Milford Nathan, who died in 1953. Known for his business acumen, Milford Nathan also was a civic leader. For many years, he was chairman of the board for the Cambridge Hospital, an active Mason and chairman of the board for the Farmers and Merchants National Bank. Later the foundation was supported further from the estates of Estelle Nathan, Milford’s wife who died in 1960, and Bertha Nathan, Milford’s sister who passed away in 1983. The Nathan Foundation is by far the largest charitable organization in Dorchester County and is permanently funded for the foreseeable future. Nathan scholarship is awarded by Nathan Foundation out of Cambridge, MD. Scholarship application information is available from local high schools in Dorchester County, MD. The scholarship is available for up to 8 semesters as long as the student is meeting the Satisfactory Academic Progress requirements. more...

Nationwide Insurance Company Scholarship
The Nationwide Insurance Company Scholarship is open to students at Anne Arundel Community College. To be considered for this award, you must be a full-time business management or business and public administration major and have a minimum 2.0 GPA. You must also demonstrate financial need. more...

Nellie Hilton-Eta Chapter Delta Kappa Gamma Scholarship
Scholarship for female, residents of Allegany County, Maryland who are full-time juniors at Frostburg State University and are majoring in Education. Applicants must have a minimum 3.5 GPA. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Educational Professions for more information. more...

Nemacolin Chapter Of Trout Unlimited Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time juniors or seniors at Frostburg State University who are majoring in Biology, Environmental Analysis & Planning or Wildlife & Fisheries with an emphasis in Fisheries Management. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 CGPA. Preference given to graduates of high schools from the tri-state area surrounding Cumberland. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. Contact the Department of Biology for more information. more...

Ness Family Endowed Scholarship
This fellowship provides scholarships to first generation college graduates, who are graduate students in the Loyola Clinical Centers and receiving training in the area of Speech Language Pathology. more...

Nettie C. Bentley Scholarships
The Music Department offers the Nettie C. Bentley Scholarships which are available, on a competitive basis, to students who are accepted or previously enrolled as candidates for the B.A. in music at Salisbury University. Scholarships are awarded annually. To qualify for consideration, applicants must have previously auditioned according to the Music Department requirements for the B.A. degree. Evidence of academic achievement is assessed through evaluation of applicants’ high school or college/university transcripts. The deadlines coincide with the deadline for department entrance auditions or March 14th, whichever comes first. Students may reapply annually. more...

Nick And Mary Mangione Scholarship Endowment Fund
Established in 2009, the Nick and Mary Mangione Scholarship supports qualified students of Italian descent. more...

Nikki Clark Scholarship
Scholarship for Allegany County, Maryland residents who are full-time undergraduate students at Frostburg State University majoring in Criminal Justice, Education, Psychology, Sociology or Social Work. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Preference given to residents of Georges Creek District. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Office of Financial Aid for more information. more...

Nina Dixon Chatham Endowment
The Nina Dixon Chatham Endowment will provide a scholarship to incoming or current SU student(s) pursuing an undergraduate degree, meeting the following criteria: A first-generation college student; a graduate of James M. Bennett High School; and prioritized by highest academic achievement or potential.
The scholarship can be renewed for a maximum of 8 semesters (4 years) provided the eligible student maintain full-time enrollment and a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better. more...

Norris - William A. Norris, Jr. Memorial
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full- or part-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Maryland, have at least a 2.0 GPA, and be enrolled in the Forestry curriculum. Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Applicant must be of good moral character. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

North Charles/Wyman Park Medical Staff Scholarships
Scholarship for Maryland residents who are undergraduate or graduate students enrolled at The John Hopkins University School of Medicine or the University of Maryland School of Medicine majoring in Medicine or Osteopathic Medicine. Students must have financial need, demonstrate academic achievement, personal qualities, and promise, and must have lived in the state of Maryland for a minimum of three years while attending high school. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Northrop Grumman Corporation
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Tri-State area, have at least a 3.0 GPA, and be enrolled in a transfer program in Engineering (preference in Mechanical, Chemical, or Electrical Engineering), Chemistry, or Business Accounting/Finance. The applicant must be a high academic achiever in Chemistry, Science or Math (B or better) and should state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

This scholarship is open to students enrolled in the College of Business and Economics who meet the following criteria:
Full-time undergraduate students;
Maryland resident;
Enrolled in the College of Business and Economics;
Finance majors in the Financial Planning Track;
Minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA or better;
Financial need as defined by the Financial Aid Office.
Please note that the Donor of this scholarship welcomes the opportunity to coach and/or mentor recipients, although this is not a requirement. more...

Nutter J. Wimbrow Iii Veterans Scholarship
The Nutter J. Wimbrow III Veterans Scholarship will provide support in the form of a scholarship to honorably discharged veterans of the US Armed Forces or the children of veterans of the US Armed Forces who were wounded or killed in action. Applicant must be either an honorably discharged veteran of the US Armed Forces or the child of a veteran of the US Armed Forces who was wounded or killed in action. Must have financial need from the FAFSA and maintain Satisfactory Academic Progress for renewal. more...

Nutter J. Wimbrow Math Scholarship
The Nutter J. Wimbrow Math Scholarship will provide scholarship support to a student pursuing a degree in math at Salisbury University. The recipient must be a sophomore of the upcoming academic year, math major, demonstrated financial need from the FAFSA and have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better. This scholarship is non-renewable. more...

Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and be U.S. citizens/permanent residents. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. Orkand Scholars Program
The Orkand Scholars Program is available to students at the University of Maryland, University College. You must have completed 90 credits, have a minimum 3.75 GPA and demonstrate financial need to be considered for this award. more...

Orpah Lee Rommel Scholarship For Education
For the Orpha Lee Rommel Scholarship for Education, the student must be in good standing in the Seidel School of Education and must fulfill the following criteria: teacher education major, cumulative 3.0 GPA; financial need from FAFSA, preference is given to a student from the Lower Eastern Shore Counties (Wicomico, Worceser or Somerset). Awards are renewable for up to four academic years as long a criteria is met. more...

Oscar "Whitey" Ruppert Rommel Scholarship
The Oscar “Whitey” Ruppert Rommel Scholarship will provide funding to a matriculated student at the junior or senior grade level at Salisbury University, with a cumulative GPA of 2.75 or better, who is either active military or a veteran. Preference will be given to a Perdue School of Business student and/or a student with an interest in entrepreneurship. Eligible students, who are veteran status, must upload a copy of their DD214 as part of the application process for this scholarship. Active Military status will be confirmed with the VA Office at Salisbury University. more...

Scholarship for graduating seniors from an Allegany or Garrett County, Maryland high school who will be enrolling full-time at Frostburg State University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and minimum SAT score of 1200. Award amount covers a room and board waiver in addition to a $1,000 Sentorial Award. Due date and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Admissions Office for more information. more...

Owens - Paul C. Owens Memorial
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Allegany or Garrett County, MD; Bedford or Somerset County, PA; or Mineral County, WV, and have at least a 2.0 GPA. Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

P. Truluck-Brown And Louis Aymard Jr. Scholarship
The P. Truluck-Brown and Louis Aymard Jr. Scholarship is open to students at Anne Arundel Community College. To be considered for this award, you must be a part-time, first-term student with demonstrated financial need. You must also be enrolled for a minimum of three credits. Preference for this award is given to parents with dependent children, students who have been out of high school for a minimum of seven years, U.S. citizens or permanent residents, and Anne Arundel County residents. more...

P.E.O Projects And Scholarships
P.E.O International Peace Scholarship Fund was established in 1949 and provides scholarships for selected international women for graduate study in the US and Canada.
Applicants:
1. Must be women from countries other than the US and Canada
2. Will be working toward a full time graduate degree
3. Will be enrolled and in residence for the entire school year of the scholarship.
4. Promise to return to their countries within 60 days of completion of their degree to pursue their professional career.
5. Do not need to be enrolled at the time of application.
6. New applications must have a full year of course work remaining.
Visit their website for more information on this scholarship. more...

Pa Technology

Applicant must attend the Bedford County Campus or the Somerset County Campus. more...

1. Nursing students in credit or non-credit courses/programs
2. Have demonstrated financial need, or
3. Who are experiencing emergency financial need, such as unexpected personal and/or family emergencies. more...

Path Scholarship Program Sponsored By The Ellucian Foundation
The PATH Scholarship Program, sponsored by the Ellucian Foundation, will provide financial assistance to currently enrolled sophomore, junior and senior grade level students, who are enrolled full-time for fall 2021 semester and are experiencing a recent economic hardship that may prevent them from completing the academic year. Eligible students must be in good academic standing and have financial need from the current FAFSA. Funding is limited on this scholarship and not all students who apply will be awarded. more...

If there are no eligible recipients from Wicomico County, other MD counties may be considered. This scholarship is non-renewable. more...

Paul P. Plevyak, Father & Son Scholarship Fund
Established in 2020, this fund is awarded by the Office of Financial Aid to a student majoring in a degree associated with business accounting or the pre-health track. Preference is given to men’s and women’s lacrosse student-athletes and students who demonstrate financial need. Awards and renewals are contingent upon the student maintaining a 3.0 GPA. more...

Pauline And Shirley T. Smith Scholarship
The Pauline and Shirley T. Smith Scholarship is awarded to students who have demonstrated academic excellence and have secured gainful employment to defray a portion of the cost of their education. This scholarship program is administered through a collaborative effort between the Mid-Shore Community Foundation (MSCF) and Salisbury University, Chesapeake College and the University of Maryland, College Park. The scholarship is granted with preference to graduates of the following named public school systems in descending order of preference: Talbot County, Caroline County and Dorchester County. Continuation of the scholarship is dependent upon the recipient maintaining full-time enrollment and a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0. The scholarship may be awarded for up to eight semesters depending on student classification at the time of first award. The scholarship is designed to fund a student’s cost of attendance including: tuition, fees , room, board and books less any other free sources of financial aid for up to eight semesters, pending funding availability. In addition to the criteria mentioned, a completed application and essay must be submitted to the Mid Shore Community Foundation by May 31st for consideration. Application information can be found on this website: Mid-Shore Community Foundation . Must be a graduate of a public high school in one of the following Maryland counties: Caroline, Dorchester or Talbot. Must have completed at least one semester of college coursework with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0. Must demonstrate financial need through filing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) for the academic year and must be enrolled full time. Must, to the extent possible, have secured gainful employment to defray a portion of the cost of the education. more...

Pauline Grace Wallis Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for college sophomores enrolled part- or full-time at Allegany College of Maryland majoring in Nursing. Students must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and be U.S. citizens/permanent residents. Preference given to Allegany County, Maryland residents. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...
