Student must attend the Bedford County Campus. Applicants must reapply for scholarship both fall and spring semester. more...

Peace
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full- or part-time student and have at least a 2.75 GPA. In a short essay, applicant should demonstrate an understanding of how to achieve peace in personal relationships, community relations and politics, and provide evidence of participating in activities that work toward peaceful outcomes. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Peake Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Maryland, Baltimore County majoring in Economics. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Pearl Family Inspirational Scholarship
The Pearl Family Inspirational Scholarship was created to reward students who have stood firm in the face of adversity; who have demonstrated the necessary grit and determination to overcome obstacles of all kinds while doggedly pursuing a teaching credential. That is the path the scholarship’s namesake followed and is the standard by which all aspirants will be evaluated. An applicant’s persistence, resilience, good humor and steadfastness will be emphasized as much as his/her academic performance if not more so during the selection process. Students must be in good standing at Salisbury University and accepted into the Teacher Education program, Must be a high school graduate of either Worcester or Somerset County, Maryland. If there are no qualified applicants from either Worcester or Somerset County, applicants may be selected from either Cecil or Wicomico County, Maryland; Education major; Junior or Senior status; 2.75 grade point average or better; Must have financial need from the FAFSA; Each applicant must prepare a 400-500 word essay describing the challenge(s) he/she has experienced and how working through these challenges impacted his/her academic performance and decision to enter the teaching profession. The essay should highlight inspirational experiences and events. Applicants are encouraged to discuss in their essays those seminal moments in their lives when they faced major turning points; what inspired them to keep going or pursue a different path? In particular, how did overcoming the challenges they faced impact their lives and how might they use their own experiences to inspire their own students once they start teaching. more...

Pence - Robert E. Pence Memorial Christian
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Four-State area, and have at least a 2.0 GPA. Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Applicant must be a “born-again Christian” and state your “born-again” experience. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Penelope Jarman Memorial Scholarship
The Penelope Jarman Memorial Scholarship is awarded to an early childhood education major. Applicants must be a junior grade level of the upcoming academic year, be enrolled full-time, have financial need from the FAFSA and have a 2.75 cumulative GPA. The Education Scholarships/Awards Committee selects recipients of the scholarship in March for the following academic year. more...

Peninsula Insurance Company Scholarship
The Peninsula Insurance Companies Scholarship will provide financial assistance to a high achieving student in the Perdue School of Business. To be considered for this scholarship students must meet the following criteria: Junior or senior grade level with a declared major in the Perdue School of Business, have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher, have demonstrated financial need (FAFSA on file). This scholarship is a one-time award and is non-renewable. more...

Incoming freshman eligibility is based on a 3.0 high school GPA or better and preference to students with financial need evidenced by the FAFSA. Eligible students must remain enrolled full-time and maintain a cumulative 3.0 GPA for continued eligibility. more...

The Perdue School of Business General Scholarship will be awarded as a one-time non-renewable scholarship based on the following criteria: enrolled full time in the Perdue School of Business; undergraduate junior or senior grade level; financial need from FAFSA and a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or greater. more...

Perdue School Of Business Student Business Leaders Scholarship
The Student Business Leader Scholarship, created by the Perdue School of Business Leaders Alumni, will provide funding for a current junior or senior grade level student in the Perdue School of Business. Students must be in good standing, enrolled full time, be a current PSB Student Business Leader, 3.3 cumulative GPA or better and submit an essay of no more than 500 words which includes information about service, leadership roles, extracurricular activities, other awards and honors and why they should be selected. The scholarship can be renewed for one additional year if awarded to a junior and eligibility criteria are met. more...

Pink I.C.E. (Increasing Cancer Education) Scholarship
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full- or part-time student, resident of any county in PA, have at least a 3.0 GPA, and be enrolled in an Allied Health Program. Student must be an alumnus of Everett Area High School and will state year of graduation in application. The student must have a personal experience dealing with cancer or with a relative going through cancer and will discuss how cancer has affected his/her life in application essay. more...

Plogman Award

Pohanka Of Salisbury International Business Scholarship
The Pohanka of Salisbury International Business Scholarship provides funding for current Salisbury University students in the Franklin P. Perdue School of Business to supplement the cost of their full semester international study abroad program or short term international study abroad program for the upcoming winter, spring or summer semesters . To be considered eligible students must meet the following criteria: Enrolled full-time with a declared business major, cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher, submit an essay of 500 or less summarizing their expectations and goals as it related to their study abroad program. This is a one-time scholarship and is non-renewable. Those who apply during spring semester can use the scholarship for a summer or fall abroad program and those who apply in the fall semester can use the scholarship for a winter, spring or summer abroad program. more...

Political Science Alumni Award

Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Political Science for more information. more...

Popernack - Lucas Popernack Memorial (Fall)
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: resident of Somerset County, PA, and must attend the Somerset County Campus or the Cumberland Campus. Scholarship is based on need and academic achievement, with preference given to students who intend to pursue a coal mining or mining related career. Scholarship will be awarded in the fall, spring, and summer semesters. more...

This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: resident of Somerset County, PA, and must attend the Somerset County Campus or the Cumberland Campus. Scholarship based on need and academic achievement, with preference given to students who intend to pursue a coal mining or mining related career. Scholarship will be awarded in the fall, spring, and summer semesters. more...

Potomac Federal Credit Union Rick L. Twigg Memorial
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Allegany County, and have at least a 3.0 GPA. Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Preference given to a student with a disability. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Potomac Therapy
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student (Students are considered “full-time” for ACM Foundation scholarships if they are enrolled in the clinical phase of a two-year, associate degree Allied Health program for eight or more credit hours.), must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Tri-State area, have at least a 2.5 GPA, and be enrolled in the Human Service Associate program. more...

Powell - The Powell Family
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, resident of Tri-State area, have at least a 3.0 GPA, state financial need in essay on scholarship application. High priority is the likely impact on the individual applicant and potential impact on the Cumberland area. Health care is a priority, but there are many other career areas with equal importance. Applicant’s essay should focus on career direction and choice, the life the applicant wishes to create, and the applicant’s financial need. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

President Charles Wight's "Lead From The Front" Scholarship
Rising leaders become great leaders because of their desire to dream more, learn more and do more. Their actions inspire others to follow them not because of their position or authority but because leaders empower others to take the next step in making the world a better place. At Salisbury University we recognize the next generation of leaders will ‘Lead From The Front’. If you are passionate about social justice, advocacy, equal rights, conservation and the environment, and supporting the underdog, we invite you to apply.
The $12,000 scholarship (paid over 4 years, with a maximum $3,000 annually) is available to an incoming, first time, undergraduate freshman Salisbury University (SU) student who has made a deposit to attend in the upcoming Fall semester and has an interest in making SU and the world a better place. The applicant must have demonstrated financial need as determined by the most current year FAFSA and will exhibit via a 500 word essay the impact their leadership has made in their home community and how they plan to continue to hone their leadership skills as an active member of the SU community. Applicants are required to complete the application and essay, have a minimum 3.3 high school GPA, and provide a nomination letter from a teacher or administrator at their high school illustrating the applicant’s contributions to the community. Students who have paid their fall admission deposit by the scholarship deadline will be given first consideration. Recipients will be notified on or around May 20th each year.
The scholarship is renewable over 4 years if the recipient meets the following criteria: annual completion of 30 credits, a cumulative GPA of 3.0 each semester, continued demonstrated financial need from the FAFSA, and a minimum of 50 hours of continued SU community involvement each academic year. The SU community involvement verification will be confirmed through the Volunteer Center within Career Services at SU. You will need to notify the Volunteer Center each time you participate in a community service program/project so that office can verify and attest to those hours. Please be sure to provide a name, contact phone number and email address of a contact person with the organization with whom you completed the service, as well as the total number of hours worked. The verification of all community service/involvement hours must be submitted to the Office of Financial Aid & Scholarships by the Volunteer Center at SU no later than May 15th each year for renewal eligibility.
Salisbury University is a Division III member of the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) and therefore athletic leadership, ability, participation or performance cannot be utilized as a criterion in the determination of your financial aid award. As you apply for scholarships within Salisbury University’s Academic Works scholarship site please do not mention athletic leadership, ability, participation or performance within any required essay as it will remove you from consideration for the award to ensure Salisbury University continued compliance with Bylaw 15.4.1 of the NCAA regulations. more...

The President's Scholarship is open to incoming freshmen at the University of Maryland, College Park. Your selection for this renewable award is based on academic achievement, extracurricular activities, awards, honors and an essay. You must be a resident of Maryland to be eligible for this award. more...

The Presidential Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Salisbury University. You must have a minimum SAT score of 1875, a minimum GPA of 3.3 and a record of participation and leadership in extracurricular activities. You must also offer talent in the arts, leadership qualities or diversity to be eligible for this award. more...

Prince Family Scholarship
The Prince Family Scholarship will provide a scholarship for a first generation student (defined as at least one parent not being a college attendee or graduate as indicated by FAFSA). Eligible students must be an incoming freshman for the upcoming academic year, have financial need from FAFSA, show evidence of being a first generation student and preference given to a student who comes from a rural background, as defined by federal and state guidelines. Can be renewed for a total of 8 semesters (4 years total) so long as the student continues to meet the Satisfactory Academic Progress policy. more...

This is a one-time scholarship. more...

Ratcliffe Entrepreneurial Excellence Scholarship
The Ratcliffe Entrepreneurial Excellence Scholarship will provide scholarships to students who have graduated from a community college receiving support from the Ratcliffe Foundation (Anne Arundel Community College, Community College of Baltimore County (including Essex campus), Harford Community College, Dabney S. Lancaster Community College or Eastern Shore Community College), be admitted to and in good standing at Salisbury University, and fulfill the following criteria: Full-time enrollment, majoring in any academic discipline and minoring in Entrepreneurship; have a transfer GPA or current GPA of 2.50 or better; students must demonstrate commitment to entrepreneurship through participation in the entrepreneurship activities directed and sponsored by the Perdue School of Business. Recipients will be encouraged to participate in the Entrepreneurship Competition and Shore Hatchery and in regional and community sponsored events such as Launch SBY.
In addition it is expected that the student join the Collegiate Entrepreneurship Organization and plan to take a leadership role in addition to being a student ambassador of entrepreneurship in the academic and business community. The scholarship can be renewed for one additional year if above criteria are satisfied. Scholarship funds may only be used for tuition, room, board and books. more...

Richard A. Henson School Of Science And Technology Scholarship - Junior Grade Level
Three – $2,000 scholarships are awarded annually to juniors in the Henson School (transfer students entering their junior year are eligible to apply for these awards). To qualify, students must provide one letter of recommendation and provide one nomination letter from the Chair of your department within their major. In addition, students must have a 3.3 cumulative GPA and be enrolled full-time. Henson Scholarships are renewed each semester provided that the awardees remain in the Henson School and maintain a minimum GPA of 3.3 for the $2,000 scholarship. Current Henson Scholars awarded as an incoming freshman student are not eligible to apply to the Henson Junior Grade Level Scholarship. more...

Richard A. Henson School Of Science And Technology Scholarship For Incoming Freshman
The Richard A. Henson School of Science and Technology annually awards three scholarships (one for $3,000 and two for $2,000) to incoming freshman students. Students must declare a major in one of the departments of the Henson School of Science & Technology and must have a record of accomplishment and service. Incoming freshman must have a minimum SAT score of 1250 or ACT of 26 and a high school cumulative GPA of 3.3 or better. Test optional admitted students must have at least a 3.7 HS GPA or better in order to apply. Henson Scholarships are renewed each semester, up to 8 semesters, provided that the awardees remain in the Henson School, enroll full-time each semester 12 credits or more and maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.3 for the $2,000 scholarship or 3.5 for the $3,000 scholarship. more...

Preference given to students from Third World countries. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. Contact the Graduate Appalachian Laboratory for more information. more...

Rick Dudley Scholarship Fund For Graduate Students With Disabilities
The first Salisbury University Foundation, Inc. scholarship for graduate students, the Rick Dudley Scholarship Fund for Graduate Students with Disabilities, provides assistance for disabled graduate scholars. This scholarship program is a continuation of the Dudley family’s abiding faith in the power of education to change lives. The Dudley Scholarship provides varying scholarship amounts to assist in a variety of situations. Full-time (7+credits) graduate students can receive $5,000 per year for up to three years; part-time (4-6 credits) graduate students enrolled in four to six credit hours per semester can receive $3,000 per year for up to four years; and part-time graduate students enrolled in three or fewer credit hours per semester can receive $1,500 per year for up to four years. A student may receive both a Graduate Assistantship and a Rick Dudley Scholarship, providing the criterion for both is met, but will receive an award of only $3,000. Applicants must meet the requirements of acceptance into a graduate program at Salisbury University and remain enrolled and in good standing in a graduate program.
Requirements: The Rick Dudley Scholarship is intended to assist individuals with “severe and substantial disabilities” in
pursuing a graduate degree at Salisbury University and is intended solely for students who meet any of the following criteria for severe and substantial disability:
 * Persons who have a permanent disability which results in the inability to ambulate without the use of a
wheelchair, cane, crutches, or a walker; or
 * Persons who have a diagnosis of Cerebral Palsy which substantially affects balance, gait, and walking endurance
in the absence of such mobility aids; or
 * Persons who are legally blind with glasses; or
 * Persons who cannot understand normal speech without amplification and are considered profoundly deaf; or
 * Persons whose speech cannot be understood by the average person; or
 * Persons who need personal assistance with activities of daily living.
Scholarship recipients must maintain continued admission status, that is be enrolled in at least one class each of the fall
and spring semesters, throughout their graduate education. The scholarship will be rescinded if the student falls below
minimum graduate program requirements for maintenance of satisfactory status. “Provisional admission” in the M.B.A.
and M.S.W. programs does not meet this scholarship criterion. A graduate student on probation will not be awarded a
scholarship. Interested applicants will need to download the Medical Opinion Form:
Medical Opinion Form
Please upload the completed Medical Opinion Form when requested. If you require further information, please contact Jessica Scott, Graduate Program Manager, at jlscott@salisbury.edu . “In lieu of Medical Opinion Form, you can provide documentation that you are registered with the SU Disability Resource Center.” more...

Rick Dudley Scholarship Fund For Graduate Students With Disabilities
The Rick Dudley Scholarship Fund for Graduate Students with Disabilities is available to students at Salisbury University. more...

Robert And Beverly Dombrowski Memorial Scholarship
Dr. Dombrowski was a long time member of the account faculty in the Perdue School. He was the advisor of Beta Alpha Psi, led the School’s Study Abroad program and created a unique Audit Internship course for his students. In 2008, he was awarded the University of Maryland Board of Regents Award for Excellence in mentoring. This scholarship will provide financial support for students who have been accepted into the accounting program in the Perdue School of Business at SU. To be eligible students must enroll as a full-time in the Accounting program in the Perdue School of Business, be a junior or senior grade level for the upcoming school year, maintain a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or better and demonstrate financial need from the FAFSA. Additional information is available from the Accounting Department/Dean’s Office in the Perdue School. more...

Robert L. Sawyer And Janet A. Walsek Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Robert L. Sawyer and Janet A. Walsek for students majoring in the Henson School of Science and Technology who have also made contributions to the life and activities within the Department of Music. To be considered for this scholarship students must meet the following criteria: Enrolled full-time in one of the following majors: : biological sciences, chemistry, geoscience, mathematics, computer science, data science or physics, cumulative GPA of 3.25 or higher, Successfully completed their freshman year as a major in one of the above mentioned disciplines, Must be a performing member of the Salisbury Symphony Orchestra, Salisbury Jazz Ensemble or Salisbury Concert Band each semester. Preference will be given to students recognized by the Department of Music for outstanding musicianship. This scholarship is not renewable but students can reapply. The Department of Music scholarship committee in the Fulton School will select recipient. more...

Robert Noyce Teacher Scholarship Program At Su
The National Science Foundation (NSF) is partnering with SU to produce more mathematics and science teachers to meet one of our country’s critical needs. Noyce scholarships prepare SU STEM majors to become exemplary middle and high school teachers. Noyce scholarships provide $10,000 for junior year and another $10,000 for senior year to complete SU’s professional teacher education program and program enhancement activities. Renewal eligibility requires a cumulative 3.0 GPA each semester, financial need from FAFSA and remaining in an eligible major. For additional renewal requirements please contact the Department.
Applications received by March 31st. will be given first consideration. Applications will be accepted through April 30th pending availability of funds.
Scholarship recipients must agree to teach in a high-need school for two years for each year of scholarship funding received. As they fulfill this teaching commitment, scholarship recipients are formally mentored by an experienced teacher and a peer support community.
If you are interested in applying for a $1,500 freshman/sophomore level Noyce internship, please email Dr. Randall Groth at the email listed below for an application. You do not apply for the internship in Academic Works.
CLICK HERE more...

The scholarship can be renewed as long as the criteria are met and funding is available. more...

Rochelle M. Clarke Scholarship
Rochelle M. Clarke is a graduate of the Perdue School of Business at Salisbury University and has established two distinct scholarships to provide financial assistance for high achieving students majoring in business related fields. The recipient of each of the scholarships must be admitted as a full time undergraduate student to the Perdue School of Business at a junior or senior grade level, have a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher and the domestic student must demonstrate financial need from FAFSA. First priority for the domestic recipient must also be matriculated into the Glenda Chatham & Robert G. Clarke Honors College. Second priority for the domestic recipient will be a declared double major both majors being in the Perdue School. Third priority for the domestic recipient will be a declared double major with at least one major being in the Perdue School. The international recipient must be admitted as an international student with first priority to a student with a major in the Perdue School and matriculated in the Honors College. Second priority for the international recipient will be to a student with a declared double major with both majors being in the Perdue School. Third priority for the international recipient will be to a student with any Perdue School major. Both scholarships will be awarded for $750 for the academic year. This is a non-renewable scholarship. more...

Roger Pyle Forestry Scholarship
Scholarship for Maryland, Pennsylvania, West Virginia, or Washington, D.C. residents who are college sophomores enrolled full-time at Allegany College of Maryland majoring in Forestry. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and be U.S. citizens/permanent residents. Preference given to female or minority students. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. more...

Ronan - The Ronan Scholarship Fund
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Allegany County, have at least a 3.0 GPA, and be enrolled in the Nursing curriculum. Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Rosann Phipps Langhans Art Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate or graduate students at Frostburg State University who are majoring in Art and Design or Art Education teaching certification. Selection based on students portfolio and talent. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. Contact the Department of Visual Arts for more information. more...

Roscoe Barlett Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Marylands Sixth Congressional District who are full-time undergraduate students at Frostburg State University who are majoring in Biology, Chemistry, Physics, or Engineering. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 CGPA and a 3.5 GPA in major. Number of awards may vary. Preference given to renewal applicants. Nonrenewable; but recipients may reapply and compete annually. Contact the Department of Biology for more information. more...

Roscoe E. Dann Sr. Memorial Scholarship
The Roscoe E. Dann Sr. Memorial Scholarship is available to students at the University of Maryland, University College. You must have completed at least 30 credits and have a minimum 3.0 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Roscoe G. Bartlett Scientific Scholarship
Scholarship for Sixth Congressional District of Maryland residents who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Allegany College of Maryland majoring in Mathematics, Engineering, Science, or rlated technical field. Students must have a minimum 3.0 overall GPA and a minimum 3.5 GPA in Mathematics and Science courses, and be U.S. citizens/permanent residents. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. more...

Rose Winder Scholarship
This scholarship is open to graduate students in Judaic Studies. more...

Rosinsky Family Scholarship Fund
This scholarship is awarded to students in the Loyola College of Arts and Sciences who demonstrate financial need. more...

Rotary Club Of Cumberland Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled part- or full-time at Allegany College of Maryland. Students must have a minimum 2.0 GPA, be U.S. citizens/permanent residents, be under 21 years of age, and be residents of Fort Cumberland Homes, Jane Frazier Village, or Benjamin Banneker Apartments, or John F. Kennedy and Queen City Towers. Applicants must NOT have been suspended from high school or convicted for substance abuse and must have applied for financial aid and the workstudy program at Allegany College of Maryland. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. more...

Roy Durrett Scholarship
Scholarship for Maryland, Pennsylvania, or West Virginia residents who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Allegany College of Maryland majoring in Automotive Technology. Students must have a minimum 2.0 GPA for the previous two years, be U.S. citizens/permanent residents, and be graduates of an Allegany County, Maryland high school or be veterans. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. more...

Roy Rogers-Plamondon Enterprises, Inc. Scholarship
Scholarship for Roy Rogers-Plamondon Enterprises, Inc. employees who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Allegany College of Maryland. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, be U.S. citizens/permanent residents, and must remain employed by Roy Rogers for a minimum of 15 hours a week through the award period. Applicants must demonstrate excellent work performance. Consideration given to community service. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Health, Physical Education and Recreation for more information. more...

Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Applicant must have no prior criminal record or drug abuse. Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Ryan K. Mcdowell Memorial Scholarship
The Ryan K. McDowell Memorial Scholarship is available to junior or senior Art majors with a concentration in three-dimensional art form: hot glass, sculpture, or ceramics. Must have a cumulative 2.5 GPA or better, preference will be given to those with financial need from FAFSA. Additional information is available from the Art Department. Recipient is selected in the fall for that current fall semester more...

S.A.M.E. (Society Of American Military Engineers) Scholarship
Scholarship for Maryland residents who are college seniors enrolled full-time at the University of Maryland, Baltimore County majoring in Engineering. Students must demonstrate financial need and academic achievement. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

S.P. Baker Scholarship
The S.P. Baker Scholarships will provide one scholarship per year for an incoming freshman Geography, Earth Science or Urban & Regional Planning major in the Henson School. It will recognize the student’s academic achievements, leadership and involvement specifically in the fields of Geography, Earth Science and/or Urban & Regional Planning. This is a non-renewable scholarship. more...

Salisbury Rotary Club Scholarship
The Salisbury Rotary Club scholarship is awarded annually for students pursuing a major in the Perdue School of Business. Renewal for succeeding years, pending availability of funds, is based on continuing in the Perdue School major and maintaining a cumulative 3.0 or better GPA. Student must be an incoming freshman that has graduated from a high school in Wicomico, Worcester, Somerset or Dorchester counties in MD, competitive SAT/ACT required. Financial need required from FAFSA. more...

Salisbury Symphony Orchestra (Sso)
Student must be enrolled in MUSA 105, enrolled in private string lessons with SU Faculty, willing to maintain the following: maintain an A in MUSA 105; have good attendance and punctuality (arrive 10 minutes early) in MUSA 105; perform in all concerts associated with MUSA 105; participate in one community service activity to be determined by Drs. Schoyen and Murasugi. Eligible students must be enrolled full-time. more...

Salisbury University Alumni Scholarship
The Salisbury University Alumni Association annually awards one scholarship to an incoming freshman student equivalent to $2,000 per year for four academic years total. Minimum qualifications include a demonstrated participation in extracurricular activities. Students admitted by February 1st are screened by the Admissions and Financial Aid offices. This information is forwarded to the Alumni Association Scholarship Committee, which selects the recipient. Preference is given to the children of Salisbury University alumni, however the scholarship is not restricted to such students. Must have 1250 SAT/25 ACT and 3.5 cumulative high school GPA. Incoming students admitted as test optional with no standardized test score can still apply as long as their high school GPA is a 3.7 or better. more...

Samuel J. Katcef Memorial Scholarship
The Samuel J. Katcef Memorial Scholarship is open to first-year students at Anne Arundel Community College. To be considered for this award, you must be a full-time business and public administration major, have a minimum 2.0 GPA, be a U.S. citizen and be a resident of Anne Arundel County (MD). You must also demonstrate financial need. more...

The Seidel Endowment Scholarship fund was established to assist students from a disadvantaged background or a non-traditional student in Teacher Education. Students must have financial need from the FAFSA. Can be renewed if a student meets satisfactory academic progress(SAP) 2.0 cumulative GPA and remains enrolled full-time as an education major. more...

Preference given to graduates of Potomac State College and those with financial need. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Office of Financial Aid for more information. more...

Sarah Foxwell Memorial Scholarship
The Sarah Foxwell Memorial Scholarship was established to provide scholarships for current and future generations of students majoring in Social Work in memory of Sarah Foxwell. Requirements for consideration include demonstrated financial need, a cumulative 3.0 GPA (high school GPA if awarded as an incoming freshman) and pursuance of a degree in Social Work. Residents of Wicomico County are given first priority for funding followed by residency within the state of Maryland. Scholarships are renewable for up to four years provided the recipient continues to meet the eligibility requirements. more...

Sarfino & Rhoades Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students at Frostburg State University who are majoring in Accounting. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 CGPA and a 3.0 GPA in Accounting courses. Preference given to seniors. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Accounting for more information. more...

Sauer - Richard H. Sauer

Applicant must state financial need, and must be a non-traditional student. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Saver's Scholarship
The Saver's Scholarship is open to students at Washington College. The college will match the amount you and your family have saved in a 529 college savings plan or Educational Savings Account. You must complete the FAFSA by March 1 in order to be considered for this award. more...

Scholarships (High School Graduates)
Scholarship for graduates of a Maryland high school who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at a Maryland Consortium campus (Johns Hopkins University, Morgan State University, Towson University, University of Maryland-College Park, Washington College, or Hagerstown Community College) majoring in Biological and Life Sciences, Chemistry, Geological Sciences, Physics, Astronomy, Engineering, or Computer Sciences. Students must be pursuing a career in Math, Science, Engineering, Technology, or a space related field and be U.S. citizens. Number of awards and award amount may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. Renewable. more...

Scholarships For Student Caregivers
As the population of older adults continues to grow and life spans lengthen, more and more young people are taking on the role of caregiver for older loved ones. While the exact number of young people taking on this responsibility is not well understood, it’s estimated to be well over 1 million.
On top of their demanding caregiving duties, many of these young people are simultaneously pursuing high school, college or graduate-level education. Scholarships for student-caregivers help ease the financial burden faced by these extremely hardworking students.
We understand that student caregivers may not have the time to scour the Internet to find available scholarships to help them pay for college. That’s why we’re handling some of that research by compiling and updating the below list to ensure they have access to the latest caregiver scholarships and information.
Caregiving is a challenging and demanding role at any age. In addition to the time investment, a 2017 Caring.com survey found that 38 percent of caregivers spend more than 30 hours a week caring for their loved one- caregiving can also be a financial drain.
Among survey respondents, 44 percent of caregivers spend at least $5,000 per year to care for their loved one, with 25 percent spending over $10,000 annually. These challenges can be exacerbated for young caregivers in school, who already face financial constraints and busy schedules while pursuing an education.
CLICK HERE FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Caring.com is a leading senior care resource for family caregivers seeking information and support as they care for aging parents, spouses and other loved ones. We have been featured by AARP, The Administration for Community Living, The National Legal Resource Center, and Forbes, as well as referenced by many governmental agencies and organizations across the Internet. more...

Scholastic Art Awards Scholarships
Scholarship for graduating high school seniors admitted to the Maryland Institute, College of Art who have received national ranking in the Scholastic Art Portfolio Competition. Applicants must have financial need. Submit FAFSA, academic transcripts, ACT/SAT scores, recommendation letters, and a slide portfolio of 12-20 pieces with application packet. Renewable; maintain 3.0 GPA. more...

Schwab - Tadd And Sandy Schwab
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student and have at least a 3.0 GPA. Preference will be given to former employees of the S. Schwab Company and their children (please describe relationship, if applicable). Applicant must state his/her goal in life and describe his/her dream job and why this job was selected. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Scott N. Ralston Memorial Scholarship
This is a $1,000 scholarship awarded to an economics major enrolled in the Perdue School of Business. If there are no eligible economics majors in a given year, then students in business administration with a track in economics will be considered. If the students being considered are finance or business administration majors in the economics track, they must be admissible to the upper division program. The scholarship is renewable for a second year, based on maintenance of a 3.3 cumulative GPA or above and a major in the Perdue School of Business as cited previously. more...

Sea Gull Century Scholarship
The Sea Gull Century and Salisbury University have enjoyed a valuable partnership for 20 years. In recognition and appreciation of this relationship, the Sea Gull Century commits to the annual funding of the Sea Gull Century Scholarship Fund at Salisbury University. Students applying for this scholarship must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA at Salisbury University, be involved in the Sea Gull Century and provide a written reflection, 500 word maximum, of the Sea Gull Century experience. This scholarship application will become available each year right after the Sea Gull Century is held and remain open for one month. more...

Seidel Award In Computer Science
The Seidel Award in Computer Science is available to academically talented upper-level computer science majors at the University of Maryland, Eastern Shore. You must be from the Eastern Shore to be eligible. more...

Seidel Scholars Program In Education & Seidel Challenge Scholarships For Incoming Freshman
The Seidel Scholars Program in Education scholarships were established to aid in the recruitment, admission and retention of incoming freshman students in the Seidel School of Education. Incoming students must have a declared major in the Seidel School of Education, 3.3 cumulative high school GPA, 1250 SAT/26 ACT and submission of a written essay. Test optional admitted students must have at least a 3.7 HS GPA or better in order to apply. Scholarships may be renewed up to eight semesters, provided the performance standards of the scholarships are maintained including full-time enrollment, major in the Seidel School of Education and have a cumulative GPA of 3.30 or better. more...

Seidel Wicomico High School Scholarship In Education
The Seidel Wicomico High School Scholarship in Education was established by the generosity of Samuel Seidel. This scholarship gives preference to students who are four-year graduates of Wicomico High School and declare a major in education. The recipient may continue to receive this scholarship provided they maintain a 2.5 GPA and full-time enrollment as an education major. The Seidel School Scholarship Committee will select the recipient. more...

Sigma Theta Tau International Nursing Honor Society Award - Grad Students
The purpose of this award is to recognize outstanding scholarship by qualified graduate nursing students who will advance knowledge in the area of nursing science and practice. Minimum qualifications included: active RN unencumbered license; currently enrolled in an accredited graduate nursing program, having completed at least 1/4 of the curriculum; demonstrate superior scholastic achievements with a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or better; preference given to Sigma Theta Tau members, all other attributes being equal. If applicant is enrolled in a graduate program outside of SU, then a copy of one’s official transcripts of graduate study/coursework completed thus far must be submitted to confirm credits completed and cumulative GPA. more...

Sigma Theta Tau International Nursing Honor Society Award - Undergraduate Students
This award is established to recognize outstanding scholarship by qualified nurses and or nursing students that will advance knowledge in the area of nursing science and practice. Minimum qualifications include: superior scholastic ability with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better; rank in the upper 35% of the graduating class; must be a full-time 1st degree or 2nd degree nursing student and completed at least one semester of the upper level required nursing courses in the baccalaureate curriculum. more...

Loyola shall give preference to students who are recipients of the Loyola University Presidential Scholarship or the Claver Scholarship. more...

Sigmund M. And Mary B. Hyman Summer Fellows Fund
This fund supports summer research opportunities for its students, affording them a stipend to study and conduct research alongside a faculty mentor during the summer months and providing both student and faculty a better understanding of the synergy between research and teaching. Students shall have the opportunity to present their findings or have their work published, if appropriate. more...

The Smoot Memorial Scholarship is available to an incoming freshman student who has graduated from a Sussex County, DE high school. Eligible students have a cumulative high school GPA of 3.0 or higher and an SAT of 1,000 or better. The scholarship can be renewed if funding is available and the recipient maintains a 2.50 cumulative GPA and completes 24 credits an academic year. more...

Stem Scholarships
Sixteen scholarships are available on a competitive basis for first-year freshman students entering Salisbury University. Eligibility is determined by high school GPA, SAT/ACT scores and other metrics. To be considered eligible for a STEM scholarship a minimum 1250 SAT/26 ACT is required as well as a 3.30 high school cumulative GPA. An essay is required as well. Students admitted as test optional with at least a 3.7 HS GPA can also be considered. STEM majors include: Biology, Biology/Environmental Science dual degree, Chemistry, Computer Science, Data Science, Earth Science, Geography, Information Systems (Perdue School), Mathematics, Physics and Physics/Engineering dual degree. In addition, Biology and Chemistry secondary education majors are also eligible. For additional information about STEM programs please Click Here
Salisbury University’s STEM scholarships are available for four years provided the student remain in a STEM major, make adequate progress on their degree requirements, and maintain a cumulative GPA of 3.3 or higher. These scholarships can be awarded in addition to other merit scholarships. Students who are admitted without a standardized test score but have at least a 3.7 H.S. GPA will also be able to apply. Please do not apply to the STEM scholarship if you do not have a STEM major, minors are not considered for eligibility. You will not be considered if you do not meet minimum qualifications and are not recommended to apply to the STEM scholarship on your personalized dashboard. more...

Stephanie Ann Roper First Year Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time, first-time students enrolling at Frostburg State University who are pursuing a Bachelor of Fine Arts Degree. Applicants must have had a minimum 3.0 GPA in Art classes in high school and submit a portfolio. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Visual Arts for more information. more...

Stephanie Ann Roper Upper Division Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time sophomores or juniors at Frostburg State University who are majoring in Art. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and be involved in art activities outside of class. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Department of Visual Arts for more information. more...

Stephanie Raphel Brown Memorial Scholarship
Named in memory of Stephanie Raphel Brown by Patrick L. Brown, ’74, this scholarship provides support to undergraduate students in the Sellinger School of Business and Management. more...

Stephen Alvarez, '91, Memorial Endowed Fund For Study Abroad Students
This fund, established by Sergio and Eleanor Alvarez, Parents ’91, is named in memory of Stephen Alvarez, ’91, who described his semester in Spain as the highlight of his Loyola experience. This fund provides support to a student studying abroad. more...

Stephen G. Hardy Scholarship
This Stephen G. Hardy Scholarship will provide funding for a Salisbury University student pursuing any undergraduate degree. Students must fulfill the following criteria to be eligible: be a resident of the state of Maryland; demonstrate financial need from the FAFSA; have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better; and enroll full-time each semester. Applicants will be prioritized by the highest academic potential and achievement. This scholarship can be renewed for a total of 8 semesters (4 years) as long the student continues to meet the Satisfactory Academic Progress policy. more...

Stephen Michael Emery & Paul Porter Emery Scholarship
The Stephen Michael Emery scholarship was established by Barbara and Charles Emery in memory of their late son. More recently, Mr. Emery lost his brother Paul Porter Emery. The SU Foundation was honored to serve as a memorial agent for the Emery family. This $500 scholarship is awarded annually to a full-time student majoring in Social Work. Student must be a SU senior (college) grade level of the upcoming school year, preference shall be given to students from the Eastern Shore of Maryland. This scholarship is non-renewable. An in-person or Zoom interview will be required by the selection committee as part of the application process. more...

Stratwealth Financial Planning Scholarship
The StratWealth Financial Planning Scholarship will provide funding to a full-time undergraduate student who has been admitted to the Perdue School of Business majoring in finance and a financial planning track. Candidate must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better. Special consideration will be given to students who have financial need from the FAFSA. more...

Stuart W. And Joanna Armiger Edwards Scholarship Fund
Established in 2015, the Stuart W. and Joanna Armiger Edwards Scholarship Fund provides scholarship assistance to rising undergraduate juniors and seniors who demonstrate both financial need and academic merit. more...

Student Ambassador Scholarship Awards
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled part- or full-time at Allegany College of Maryland. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, be 18 years of age or older, have excellent oral communication skills, and be able to volunteer three hours per week in Ambassador Program related activities. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

Su Art Scholarship
The Art Department offers a limited number of scholarships each year with opportunity to renew the following year. Available to full-time incoming freshman or transfer students with a declared Art major, may be renewed based on availability of funds. Must have been a recipient of the Art Department Scholarship as an incoming freshman or transfer student. Renewal applications must be made up of new work completed since previous portfolio submission. more...

Su Study Abroad General Scholarship
The SU Study Abroad Scholarship will be awarded twice per year, once for summer/fall and once for winter/spring semesters. Recipients are determined by a combination of cumulative GPA, application essay and demonstrated financial need from FAFSA. Study abroad program must be approved by the Janet Dudley-Eshbach Center for International Education. Students must have also applied and been accepted to the study abroad program. Application process is open June 1 to October 15 for a scholarship to be used during the upcoming winter, spring or summer abroad program only. more...

Summer Research Fellowship In Economics (Current Use)
Established in 2021, this fund is to provide a stipend for undergraduate economics students (major or minor) to pursue and engage n an independent summer research program with a faculty member in the department of economics. more...

Susan M. Kolb Parents Association Endowed Scholarship
Susan M. Kolb was a founding member of the former Parents Association at Towson University. Her son Matthew graduated in 2002 with a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems. She was an active supporter of Towson University, helping with Parents Weekend, move-in weekend, and other events. Susan Kolb passed away in 2005. This award is designated for students of current Family Network members and is in memory of Susan, wife of Ronald Kolb and mother of Matthew Kolb ’02 and Adam Kolb. At least one (1) award will be given each year. more...

Students must have a minimum 2.0 GPA and be U.S. citizens/permanent residents. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

The recipient must demonstrate financial need from FAFSA. The scholarship is renewable for a total of four years provided the recipient maintains a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA at Salisbury University. more...

Minimum eligibility requirements are: full-time education major and cumulative GPA of 2.75 or better. Scholarships are awarded as one-time only and are not renewable, although you can reapply each year. more...

The Beer Family
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full- or part-time student, resident of Somerset County, and have at least a 3.0 GPA. Preference will be given to student enrolled in the History curriculum, although students enrolled in Psychology, Sociology, Social Work, Social Science, or Political Science will be considered. Applicant must attend the Somerset County Campus or the Cumberland Campus. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

The Buchanan Family Scholarship
The Buchanan Family Scholarship will provide funding to a current junior or senior grade level student pursuing an undergraduate degree meeting the following criteria: acceptance into one of the following programs – chemistry, biology or nursing; minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0; and preference to a student with demonstrated financial need from FAFSA. Scholarship may be renewed a second year if awarded as a junior and criteria are still met. more...

The Dean’s Scholarship
The Dean’s Scholarship is available to in-state freshman and/or sophomore students at University of Maryland, College Park . You must demonstrate academic achievement, extracurricular activities, awards, honors, and an essay to be eligible for this award. more...

The Dircks Family Men's Lacrosse Scholarship Fund
Established in 2010 by the Dircks family, this fund, the first named scholarship solely for men’s lacrosse, supports men’s lacrosse student-athletes who show potential both in the classroom and on the playing field. more...

The Garner/Emery Accounting Scholarship
The Garner/Emery Accounting Scholarship will provide funding to a incoming freshman student pursuing an undergraduate degree in accounting in the Perdue School of Business. Eligible recipients must be a resident of Maryland and have 2.8 cumulative GPA or higher. The scholarship can be renewed for up to 5 years (10 consecutive semester) if criteria are still met. more...

The John Apple Seeds For Change Scholarship For Social Work
This scholarship will provide funding to a junior or senior grade level student pursuing an undergraduate degree in social work and meeting the following criteria: 3.0 cumulative GPA or higher, completion of a short essay and enrolling full time each semester. The scholarship may be renewed for one additional year if awarded as a junior. more...

The Joseph And Mary Ellen Hrutka Scholarship
The Joseph and Mary Ellen Hrutka Scholarship is available to students at the University of Maryland, University College. You must have completed 15 undergraduate credits at UMUC, have a minimum 3.0 GPA and demonstrate financial need to be considered for this award. more...

The Kimmerly Messick Scholarship
The Kimmerly Messick Scholarship will provide renewable scholarship(s) to current/transfer undergraduate students with a declared major in the Perdue School of Business and meeting the following criteria: resident of Worcester or Wicomico County, MD; cumulative GPA of 2.0 or better; demonstrated financial need from FAFSA; preference given to students with entrepreneurial interest; and completion of a short essay (250 words or less) explaining what impact this scholarship will have on the pursuit of your educational and professional goals.. This scholarship can be renewed for up to 8 semesters max. if the recipient maintains satisfactory academic progress (SAP), remains in an eligible Perdue School major and has financial need from FAFSA.
Kimmerly Messick, known locally as the “Furniture Queen,” spent her career building Furniture Inc. consisting of four successful retail furniture stores on the Lower Eastern Shore with over 50 employees. After putting herself through college, Kimmerly graduated from Salisbury University. During her time at school, Kimmerly worked year round to pay for all of her educational expenses and applied for every scholarship she could find. A personal goal of hers was to pay back every institution and or person that helped her along the way. In this spirit, she established the Kimmerly Messick Scholarship for Salisbury University students from her two home towns of Worcester County and Salisbury, Maryland. As an endowed scholarship, the Kimmerly Messick Scholarship will help countless young entrepreneur business students into perpetuity. Kimmerly’s mission is to create a legacy of philanthropy and leave student recipients with a strong message about giving back with the hope they will one day create their own scholarship at SU or contribute to her scholarship. more...

The Marilyn Webb Scholarship
The Renee & William Smith scholarship will provide scholarships to students enrolled in the Master of Social Work program who plan to pursue careers in mental health or addictions counseling. Students must have a cumulative 3.0 GPA or better and the scholarship can be renewed for one additional year for a total of 4 semesters/2 years in all. more...

The Marilyn White Scholarship For Nursing
The Marilyn White scholarship will provide funding to current undergraduate students accepted into the nursing program with demonstrated financial need from the FAFSA. The scholarship can be renewed one additional year if awarded as a junior and criteria are met. more...

The Proctor Family Cadr Graduate Scholarship
The Proctor Family CADR Graduate Scholarship will be awarded to a member of the rising second year CADR master’s degree cohort who, in the judgement of the CADR department faculty, shows particular promise in the field of dispute resolution. The scholarship recipient will be selected each spring and awarded for the upcoming academic year. more...

The Richard & Karin Hoffman Study Abroad Scholarship
The Richard & Karin Hoffman Study Abroad Scholarship will provide funding to a full-time student who has been admitted to the Perdue School of Business and wishes to study abroad. Applicants must have a cumulative 3.31 or better. Special consideration will be given to students who are residents of the Eastern Shore of Maryland. Secondary consideration will be given to students who demonstrate financial need from FAFSA. The recipient will be selected by the Perdue School Student Development Committee. This is a non-renewable scholarship to be used during the semester that you will study abroad. more...

The Robert & Carolyn Fitzgerald Scholarship For Nursing
The Robert & Carolyn Fitzgerald Scholarship for nursing will provide funding to current students pursuing an undergraduate nursing degree, meeting the following criteria: resident of the state of Maryland; graduate of a Somerset County, MD public high school and admittance into the nursing program. The scholarship may be renewed for an additional year if awarded as a junior and minimum requirements are met including a 3.0 cumulative GPA or better and remaining in the nursing program. more...

The Rotary Club Of Wicomico County
The Rotary Club of Wicomico County Scholarship will provide a non-renewable scholarship to a non-traditional undergraduate or graduate student, enrolled full time or part time with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better and meeting the following criteria: student must be from Wicomico County, MD; student must demonstrate financial need from the FAFSA; Preference given to a student who shows full or part time employment; and must have completed a current FAFSA indicating an independent status. This is a non-renewable scholarship but students may reapply in a subsequent year. more...

The Roy S. Perdue Alumni Scholarship
The Roy S. Perdue Alumni Scholarship will provide financial support for an incoming freshman, preference to children of SU alumni, who have been accepted to Salisbury University with a high school GPA of 3.5 or better on a 4.0 scale and SAT of 1250 or better or ACT of 26 or better. The scholarship is renewable yearly for a total of four years. The student must maintain a 3.0 cumulative GPA for renewal. The Alumni Association Scholarship Committee will select recipients. more...

The Victor H. Laws Jr. Scholarship will provide financial support for one or more deserving undergraduate, full-time enrolled, pre-law students, with preference given to students from the Eastern Shore of Maryland. Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better is required to receive and retain this scholarship. The scholarship can be renewed as long as funding is available and pre-law requirements are met with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better. more...

Non-traditional students are those that are considered independent on the FAFSA for financial aid purposes. more...

Thomas G. Elliot Orchestral Scholarship
The Thomas G. Elliot Scholarship, in the amount of $1,000, will be awarded to students who are enrolled at Salisbury University. The awards are made on the basis of talent and may be renewable for up to four years. All students must audition with the conductor of the orchestra and the orchestra player’s committee. String students will be highly encouraged to apply. Students from all majors are invited to apply. All students accepting this scholarship must meet the following criteria: play and be enrolled in the orchestra for credit each semester, be enrolled in applied lessons at the University on their instrument, and maintain an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0. Students must reapply each year. more...

Tyler - Thomas O. Tyler, Iii, Excellence In Forestry
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time second- or third-year student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Maryland, and have at least a 3.0 GPA. Awarded solely on merit, essay should be comprehensive and reflect why the student has chosen this field of study and career aspiration. Preference will be given to those enrolled in the Forest Technology curriculum, although Forestry Transfer will be considered. This is a second- and third-year scholarship for a student interested in pursuing a B.S. degree in Forestry from a Society of American Foresters accredited program. Continuation of scholarship into third year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Under Armour Scholarship ( Current Use)
Established by Under Armour in 2014, this scholarship provides support to students from the Greater Baltimore area who are juniors majoring in accounting or finance, maintain a 3.2 GPA, and will contribute to the racial and ethnic diversity of the student body in the Sellinger School of Business and Management. more...

University Orchard Scholarship
The University Orchard Scholarship is a one-time, non-renewable $10,000 scholarship, where candidates will be required to write a one page essay discussing their impact on campus life at Salisbury University. Additional eligibility requirements include: full-time undergraduate; cumulative 3.0 GPA; financial need from the FAFSA; resident of (preference – have graduated high school from) Wicomico, Worcester, Somerset or Dorchester Counties in MD; have at least 2 semesters left at SU. Preference to currently enrolled students first, then newly admitted students for the upcoming academic year. The mission of the scholarship is to partner with Salisbury University to create opportunities for SU students that come from the Lower Eastern Shore communities. You DO NOT need to be a resident of University Orchard in order to apply to this scholarship!
University Orchard, a Campus First student property, is located less than one-half mile from the main campus of Salisbury University. Campus First is committed to not only being the premier provider of off-campus student housing for Salisbury University, but is equally excited to support the University by introducing this new scholarship opportunity. more...

Upmc Western Maryland
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student (students are considered “full-time” for ACM Foundation scholarships if they are enrolled in the clinical phase of a two-year, associate degree Allied Health program for eight or more credit hours.), must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Four-State area, have at least a 3.0 GPA, and be enrolled in a health care curriculum. Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, be U.S. citizens/permanent residents, have completed the first year of the Dental Hygiene program, and demonstrate ethical and professional standards. Number of awards may vary. more...

Upper Potomac Dental Hygienists' Society

Applicant must have completed the first year of the Dental Hygiene Program. Applicant must be an active member of the Student American Dental Hygienists’ Association and maintain high ethical and professional standards. more...

To be eligible students must be a full-time junior or senior in the Perdue School of Business; be a Maryland resident; have a cumulative 3.0 GPA including all transfer work. Students must submit two letters of recommendation. Additional scholarship information is availalbe in the Perdue School of Business Dean’s Office. more...

Verizon Communications-Maryland Scholarship
Scholarship for Allegany County, Maryland residents who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Allegany College of Maryland majoring in Math, Science, or Computer related field. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, be U.S. citizens/permanent residents, and good moral character. Number of awards may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

Verizon Technology Scholarship
Scholarship for Maryland residents who are full-time juniors, seniors or graduate students at Frostburg State University that are majoring in Computer Science. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 CGPA. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. Contact the Department of Computer Science for more information. more...

Veronica K. Rachuba Memorial Quasi Endowed Scholarship
Established by a bequest in 2016, this scholarship will be used to assist one or more students in need of financial assistance. more...

Vietnam Veterans Of America, Chapter 172 (Full-Time)
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Allegany or Garrett County, MD; Mineral or Hampshire County, WV; or Bedford or Somerset County, PA, be a high school graduate or have a GED, have at least a 2.0 GPA, and be a Vietnam era Veteran, (January 1, 1959 to May 7, 1975), the spouse, child (including adopted or stepchild), grandchild, or descendant of such a Veteran. Applicant must submit DD-214 document with application. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Vietnam Veterans Of America, Chapter 172 (Part-Time)
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Part-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Allegany or Garrett County, MD; Mineral or Hampshire County, WV; or Bedford or Somerset County, PA, be a high school graduate or have a GED, have at least a 2.0 GPA, and be a Vietnam era Veteran, (January 1, 1959 to May 7, 1975), the spouse, child (including adopted or stepchild), grandchild, or descendant of such a Veteran. Applicant must submit DD-214 document with application. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Vietnam Veterans Of America, Chapter 172 Scholarship
Scholarship for Allegany or Garrett County, Maryland, and Mineral or Hampshire County, West Virginia, and Bedford or Somerset County, Pennsylvania residents who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Allegany College of Maryland. Students must have a minimum 2.0 GPA, be U.S. citizens/permanent residents, be high school graduates or GED recipients, and be Vietnam era veterans (January 1, 1959 to May 7, 1975), their spouses, children, grandchildren, or descendants. Number of awards may vary. A DD-214 document must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

Vincent D. Leisey Student Involvement & Leadership Honors Scholarship
The Vincent D. Leisey Student Involvement and Leadership Honors Scholarship will provide financial support for a student accepted into the Honors College and who is active in campus life through student clubs and activities. This scholarship for a rising junior will be renewable for their senior year if criteria are still met. more...

Vintz Family Scholarship
Established in 2014, this scholarship provides support to undergraduate students in the Sellinger School of Business and Management. more...

Vintz Family Scholarship (Current Use)
Established in 2020, this current use scholarship will provide support to undergraduate students in the Sellinger School of Business and Management. more...

Virginia Mills Edwards Nursing Scholarship
The Virginia Mills Edwards Nursing Scholarship recognizes and funds students who desire to become registered nurses. Priority is given to residents of Dorchester (first), Somerset (second) and Wicomico (third) counties and licensed practical nurses or medical technicians (fourth, with priority given to Dorchester General Hospital employees). Students must be enrolled full-time and be a junior or senior of the upcoming semester. Letters of application should be submitted to the Virginia Mills Edwards Scholarship Board, with an essay stating in no less than 300 words the qualifications of the applicant. The Virginia Mills Edwards Scholarship Board awards scholarships annually for the next academic year. Information is available from the Department of Nursing. more...

Voiture Locale #122 Nurses Training Scholarship
The Nurses Training Scholarship, unique to the 40 & 8 Voiture Locale, was established in the organization in 1955 as a means of ensuring adequate numbers of skilled nurses for our nation in time of war and peace. To be considered for this scholarship the student must: Be admitted into the nursing professional program or is working to obtain a Bachelor’s of Science in Nursing; Demonstrate financial need from the FAFSA; Have a strong academic standing, participation in community service and community activities; The award is renewable for up to one additional year (two years in total) as long as the student remains in an eligible program and funds are available; Selection is made by the Nursing Department more...

W. Lawson King Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for current or alumni 4-H members enrolled at an accredited postsecondary institution pursuing studies in an Agriculture related field. Students must have financial need, demonstrate leadership abilities, resourcefulness, and have completed a minimum of two years in the Maryland 4-H. Number of awards may vary. more...

W. Tracy And Frances Lord Holland Scholarship
The W. Tracy and Frances Lord Holland Scholarship is awarded annually to a junior or senior student in good standing in the Perdue School of Business. Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 is required. Recipient must be a resident of Wicomico County and have financial need from the most recent FAFSA. This scholarship is not automatically renewable, must apply each year, pending availability of funds, based on maintenance of the above criteria. more...

Wade - Sheriff Donald R. Wade Memorial
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full- or part-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Allegany County, have at least a 3.0 GPA, and be enrolled in the Criminal Justice curriculum. Applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Waesche Family Scholarship Fund
Established by the Waesche family, this scholarship fund provides support to students enrolled in the Sellinger School of Business and Management. more...

Wainwright Scholarship
The Wainwright Scholarship is available to incoming freshman undergraduate students at Capitol Technology University. You must have a minimum GPA of 2.5 to be eligible for this award. more...

Walker - John Walker Memorial
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full- or part-time student, resident of Somerset County, have at least a 2.0 GPA. Preference given to students enrolled in the business curriculum, although other curricula will be considered, and preference given to students who are members of the First United Methodist Church in Somerset. Applicant must attend the Somerset County Campus. more...

Walker - Lillian Taylor Walker Memorial
This scholarship will be awarded to a deserving student who has met the following minimum qualifications: Full- or part-time student, must be a U.S. citizen/permanent resident, resident of Tri-State area, and have at least a 3.0 GPA. The applicant must state financial need in essay on scholarship application. Continuation of scholarship into second year is possible upon reapplication and proof of having met criteria. more...

Wallace Q French Memorial Scholarship
The Wallace Q. French Memorial Scholarship is a two-year, $2,000-per-year award given annually by the Tidewater Environmental Health Association in memory of their colleague Wallace Q. French. Applicants must be natural science (earth science or physics), biology, or chemistry majors; must be a junior or senior of the upcoming year; have a cumulative 3.0 GPA and must submit a short essay discussing career goals in the science field. Recipients are selected by the Tidewater Environmental Health Association and the faculty of the Henson School of Science. more...

Walter & Elmyra Hahn Frederick County Scholarship
Scholarship for graduates of a Frederick County, Maryland high school who are full-time juniors or seniors at Frostburg State University that are majoring in Education. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Preference given to students who will be teaching at the elementary or early childhood level. Number of awards may vary. Renewable. Contact the Department of Educational Professions for more information. more...

Walter And Annie Pike Scholarship
The Walter and Annie Pike Scholarship is available to students at Capitol Technology University. more...

Scholarship for Maryland, Pennsylvania, West Virginia, or District of Columbia residents who are undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Allegany College of Maryland. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, be U.S. citizens/permanent residents, and be planning to transfer to a four-year Christian institution pursuing further education in active ministry. Number of awards may vary. Preference given to male students. An essay must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

Washington County Homemakers Scholarship
Scholarship for residents of Washington County, Maryland who are undergraduate or graduate students at Frostburg State University. Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. Preference given to Washington County Homemakers Club and/or their dependents/descendants. Due date and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Office of Financial Aid for more information. more...

Scholarship for residents of the Washington, D.C. area who are undergraduate students admitted to Hood College. Applicants must have outstanding achievement. Due date and number of awards may vary. Award amount is full-tuition, fees, room and board. more...

Applicants must state financial need in essay on scholarship application and must have taken the Allegany College of Maryland Placement Test. more...

Wayne And Melissa Judkins Family Scholarship Fund
The Wayne and Melissa Judkins Family Scholarship Fund provides scholarship funding, with preference given to students who 1) pursue majors within the Perdue School of Business or the Seidel School of Education and who are 2) graduates of Col Zadok Magruder High School or North East High School 3) residents of Montgomery or Cecil Counties, or 4) residents of other Maryland counties. The scholarship is awarded based on high school GPA, SAT, county of residence and intended academic program. The scholarship is renewable provided the student remain in good standing at SU. more...

Preference is given to students who would contribute to the racial, ethnic, and gender diversity of the student body studying computer science, physics, mathematics, and statistics. more...

William B. And Betty B. Krieger Scholarship
The William B. and Betty B. Krieger Scholarship provides financial assistance to students with financial need (from FAFSA) and deserving students with preference given to graduates of Colonel Richardson High School. Students can be awarded as incoming freshmen or current students and must maintain Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) toward a degree and be enrolled full-time to remain eligible for scholarship renewal. Students may receive this funding for up to 8 semesters total. more...

William Chaney Bunn Memorial Scholarship In Environmental Studies
The William Chaney Bunn Memorial Scholarship in Environmental Studies will be awarded to a Salisbury University current undergraduate, full-time student with a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA. First preference to a resident of Anne Arundel County MD, then any student in Maryland. Must be an environmental studies major and demonstrate involvement in environmental activities or other organizations outside the education setting by an essay or other means. The scholarship is renewable if the recipient has a 3.0 minimum cumulative GPA for up to three times after the initial award (contingent on funding availability). more...

William F. Englehardt Memorial Scholarship
The William F. Englehardt Memorial Scholarship is open to students at Anne Arundel Community College. To be considered for this award, you must be enrolled in at least nine credits, be enrolled in any career or technical program and have a minimum 2.5 GPA. You must also be a U.S. citizen and resident of Anne Arundel County (MD). more...

William H. Wroten Jr. Scholarship In History
The William H. Wroten scholarship is awarded annually to a history undergraduate or graduate student who has made a significant contribution to the study of the colonial Eastern Shore or who has produced an exceptional work of original historical study. Established by the Class of 1959, the scholarship recognizes the long-standing service of Dr. Wroten as Chair of the History Department. The recipient is selected by the Wroten Scholarship Committee. Information is available from the History Department. This scholarship is awarded for the current spring semester. more...

William J. Holman Scholarship Fund

William Kapell International Piano Competition
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled at the University of Maryland. Students must be 18 to 33 years of age. This is a piano competition. more...

William M. Folger Scholarship
The William M. Folger Scholarship was created in the name of the Director of Choral Studies at Salisbury University. An anonymous donor made the initial endowment to start the scholarship program to recognize Dr. Folger’s effort and dedication in bettering the music programs at Salisbury University. At present, the Folger Scholarship, instituted in June 2005, provides a scholarship to a student participating in the University Chorale, one of five major performing ensembles in the Department of Music. The scholarship is awarded by audition by the Director of Choral Studies and with the approval of the Dean of the Fulton School of Liberal Arts. Eligible students may be from any major of study, must participate in the University Chorale during the semester of the award, and complete the audition process. Contact the Music Department for more information. more...

William M. Folger Scholarship
The William M. Folger Scholarship is available to students at Salisbury University. You must be participating in the University Chorale to be eligible for this award. more...

Wood-Miller Scholarship Program At Salisbury University
This fund will honor Ms. Wood’s beloved professor, Dr. Leonard (Lee) Garigilano, and provide scholarships for current and future generations of students in the Seidel School of Education at Salisbury University. This scholarship will specifically target those students who express interest and possess aptitude for teaching math and science in Secondary Education (7th- 12th Grades). Eligible students must be admitted to the professional program in their major. Scholarships are renewable for up to two years providing student(s) remain in good academic standing and continue their studies in teacher education. more...

Preference given to non-traditional students (25 or older). Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. Contact the Office of Financial Aid for more information. more...

Zoey Dipasqua Endowment For The Betty Turner Honors Nursing Scholarship
Zoey DiPasqua’s parents teach in the Nursing Department at SU. Zoey has created an endowment in memory of Betty Turner, a former SU faculty member and longtime PRMC nurse. Students must be accepted into the Honors College, be a full-time Junior or Senior grade level, accepted into the Nursing program, have a cumulative 3.5 GPA or better and submit one letter of recommendation from the nursing faculty and an essay. more...
